loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in the AirPort area of Margibi County. She is 38 years old and married with three children between the ages of 7 and 22, only two of whom are in school and live at home. Her husband works with Firestone. She completed 8th grade before starting her business, which she has had for the past seven years now, selling rice, pepper, vita, sugar and salt in the local market. She works for eight hours from Monday to Saturday. She described herself as a hardworking business woman. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build her house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, pepper, vita, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Mayanmu

texts.en:
Mayanmu is 25 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea. It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

She is married. She completed 4th grade before establishing her business five years ago by selling for her older sister. She started this business with the little money given to her by her older sister, opening a table market to sell body cream, soap, grease and perfume. She learned this way of selling from her older sister. She likes how people respond to her business, and mostly, she enjoys the interaction of her customers. She sells nine hours each day from Monday to Saturday.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, soap, grease and perfume for her business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, soap, Greece, and perfume for her business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.es:
La Gemma tiene 48 años, ella y su marido tiene un local comercial de venta de cosméticos en el mercado desde el año 2010. Gracias al trabajo que están  realizando pueden mantenerse. Gemma  ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta con sus compromisos. 
Solicita este crédito para  la compra de un mueble para exhibir sus productos. Agradece por la  oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gemma is 48-years-old; she and her husband have had a commercial locale in the market since 2010 where she sells cosmetics.  Thanks to the work they’ve been doing they are able to support themselves.  Gemma has shown herself to be a very responsible honest person with her commitments.

She’s requesting this loan to buy a piece of furniture to display her products.  She’s grateful for the opportunity she’s getting since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: Jinypher

texts.en: Jinypher is 25 years old and is single, living in Bañadero, Ozamiz City. For years, she had stopped studying for there were some hindrances that happened along the way. Lately, she decided to continue in order to pursue her dream. She joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to cover the costs of her first semester tuition fees. But  this is not enough because Jinypher needs school materials too. Without hesitation, she is requesting another loan of 5,000 PHP to buy school materials like notebooks, bags, uniforms and books. Jinypher is in her fourth year of studying  Bachelor of Science in Education at La Salle University in Ozamiz City. She is thankful to GDMPC for helping students to continue their studies and is hopeful to finish her course and be able to work as a teacher some day.

loans.use: to buy school materials like notebooks, bags, uniforms and books

loans.name: Shohrukh

texts.ru: Шохрух 24-летний молодой человек, проживающий в районе Хамадони со своей матерью и младшей сестрой.  Он еще не женат. Шохрух имеет свой бизнес. Он торгует тканями на рынке.  Шохрух занимается данным бизнесом с юного возраста. Он начал этот бизнес в 14 лет и уже 10 лет успешно продолжает его.  Ему в бизнесе помогает мать и сестра. Он продает разнообразные красивые ткани для шитья платья. Одновременно Шохрух занимается предоставлением услуги такси по маршрутной линии город Душанбе – района Хамадони. Сейчас Шохрух запрашивает кредит для развития своего торгового бизнеса. Он хочет увеличить ассортимент сезонных тканей.  Дальнейшие планы Шохруха – это расширение бизнеса и открытие еще одной торговой точки.
texts.en:
Shohrukh is a 24-year-old young man, residing in the Hamadoni region with his mother and younger sister. He is not yet married. 

Shohrukh has his own business. He sells fabrics at the market. Shohrukh has been engaged in this business from a young age. He stared this business at 14 and has ten years of successfully continuing it. His mother and sister help him in the business. He sells a variety of beautiful fabrics for sewing dresses. 

At the same time, Shohrukh provides taxi services along the route lines of Dushanbe to the Hamadoni region. 

Now, Shohrukh is requesting a loan for the development of his trade business. He wants to expand the range of seasonal fabrics. 

Shohrukh's further plans: the expansion of the business and opening of another trade outlet.

loans.use: to purchase varied seasonal fabrics to increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour to increase her quantity of bread.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school.   The other one is very young. She stays at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

For the past three years, she has operated a dumpling-sales business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other dumpling sellers. 

With the Ksh 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for preparation of dumplings

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima appreciates Kiva and Yehu for the previous loan that enabled her make profits in her business. She was able to use the profits to improve her living standards.

Tima is requesting another loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase wheat flour, milk, sugar, eggs, and baking powder for the bakery business. She joined Yehu for financial support and she appreciates for the support

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, milk, sugar, eggs, and baking powder for the bakery business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise such as blouses, jeans, lotions and perfumes at wholesale prices

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат 26 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 2011 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле детскими вещами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 50,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Гулзат имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли начать постройку большого дома для своей семьи. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гулзат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Гулзат планирует вложить в завершение стройки и накопить деньги на обучение своих детей. ЗАО МФБ "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФБ "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одним из лидирующих Микрофинансовых банков Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Gulzat is 26 years old. Together with her husband she has two children (one daughter, one son). In 2011, the couple started a business trading children's clothing, using as starting capital a sum of 50,000 som (KGS). Having managed to develop their business and to find regular customers, Gulzat has an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to hard work in the business, the couple was able to start to build a large home for their family. 

In order to further improve and expand their business, Gulzat turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to expand inventory. 

Gulzat plans to invest income from the loan in the completion of construction and to save money for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for resale

loans.name: Augustine's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are primary school teachers from the southern city of Bo. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, which is based in Makeni in the northern Sierra Leone area, to apply for a loan of SLL 4,300,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to meet their most immediate and pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the deductions and repayments on their behalf.

Augustine is the featured leader of this group. The 38-year-old is a native of Bo city. He is married to a nurse and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending schools. Augustine has been a school teacher for 16 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials such as iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Raymond A.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of a vocational institution in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a total loan of 12,300,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial needs. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school's bursar who is directly responsible for taking the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Raymond is the featured leader of the team. The 50-year-old is a native of Matru. He is married to a housewife, and together they have three children who are attending school. Raymond has been a professional school teacher for 30 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets and cement for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like corrugated iron sheets and cement for the construction of a house

loans.name: Margaret J.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT to apply for a loan of SLL 7,900,000.00 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they are being empowered to meet their most immediate and most pressing financial challenges. And at the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Margaret is the featured leader of this team. A native of Kawaya in southern Sierra Leone,  Margaret is married to a teacher and the couple has seven children.  Margaret is a school teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 36 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house building materials like iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like iron rods, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Ndunge

texts.en:
Ndunge appreciates Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her generate profits she used to improve her living standards.

She is requesting for a loan of ksh.25,000 to purchase tomatoes, onions,and vegetables for resale.

Ndunge joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions,and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 55-year-old, married woman. She has six children, whose ages range from 14 to 28 years. She describes herself as focused. She operates a clothing store, where she sells second-hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her customers are mostly local people. She says her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more clothes to offer for sale. Her business goal is to grow, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Lizy

texts.en:
Lizy is 29 years old, married, and supports a family of four. Her spouse is called Richard, and he helps  her in meeting some of the family's financial needs. 

Lizy runs a clothing business in Nandi county and is served by KADET Ltd, Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last six years, From this business, she gets an average monthly profit of Kshs 15,000.

She has borrowed a fifth loan of Kshs 100,000 after successfully repaying her previous loans, She plans to use the amount borrowed to purchase clothes for sale. She anticipates getting profit from the business and she plans to use the money to repay the loan, pay school fees for her children and save some for expansion of her business. Her dream is to expand her business and save enough money to enable her to open a textile industry.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a married woman. She has three children who are between 4 and 12 years old. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a timber yard where she sells timber. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add to her stock of timber for resale. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was paid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of timber for resale

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is a married man, age 39, who supports four members of his family. He has four children between the ages of 8 and 2. Mike keeps livestock in Koisamo, Kenya and has been in operation for six years. He earns 13,000 KES monthly.

He is now servicing his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD and hopes to use this money to purchase more livestock for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to expand his current business. His dream is to get good returns from his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for trading

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva, which enabled her to improve her living standards and generate more profit through her sales. In addition she sells clothes to supplement her income. 

She is now requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase two bales of clothes for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Madosho

texts.en:
Madosho appreciates the previous loan he took from Kiva. It enabled him to stock his retail shop and generated profits he used to take care of his family.

He is requesting KSHS 10,000 to purchase sacks of rice, sugar and beans for his business. He joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Mariela De Jesús

texts.es: Mariela, a sus 44 años de edad, es viuda y no tiene hijos. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes restaurantes y cafeterías como empleada; pero, desde hace un año, decidió independizarse y montó su propio negocio, un restaurante donde trabaja de Lunes a Domingo, con el fin de aprovechar al máximo la ubicación del negocio, pues está ubicado al frente de una terminal de buses y en el sector existen muchos talleres de mecánica, por lo que ha obtenido buenos resultados en las ventas. La cliente es una mujer trabajadora, activa, emprendedora y dedicada a su labor, esto la motiva a solicitar otro ciclo de crédito para invertirlo en la compra de surtido (carnes, granos, verduras, gaseosas, frutas), con el fin de tener mayor disponibilidad de insumos para preparar los alimentos que vende y para aprovechar unos activos fijos que posee, pues en el momento están sub-utilizados y quiere sacar el mayor provecho de ellos.  Mariela sueña con montar otro restaurante, que sea reconocido por la calidad de los productos que vende y por el excelente servicio que se presta; esto atraerá más clientela y podrá continuar solventando sus necesidades básicas  pues sus ingresos aumentarán significativamente.
texts.en:
Mariela, 44, is a widow; she has no children.  She’s spent her entire productive life working as an employee in various restaurants and cafeterias but a year ago she decided to become independent and open her own business: a restaurant she works in Monday to Sunday aiming at taking maximum advantage of its location because it’s across from a bus terminal and many mechanic shops are nearby which has led to good sales results.

She’s a hardworking, active, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work.  This motivates her to request another loan cycle to buy supplies (meat, grains, vegetables, soft-drinks, fruit) aiming at having more ingredients on-hand to prepare the meals she sells and to make use of some fixed assets she has that are currently under used and she wants to make maximum use of.

Mariela dreams with opening another restaurant that will be well-known for the quality of the products she sells and for the excellent service it provides.  This will attract more customers and she will be able to continue meeting her basic needs because her income will increase significantly.

loans.use: to buy supplies (meat, grains, vegetables, soft-drinks, fruit).

loans.name: Olga Lucía

texts.es: Olga, a sus 40 años es casada y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio propio, un restaurante donde ofrece desayunos, almuerzos, mecato, fritos y gaseosas, de esta manera ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Olga es una señora emprendedora, activa, pujante y lucha incansablemente para darle continuidad a su negocio, trabaja arduas jornadas desde las 7:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm. Esta actividad la alterna con la venta de mercancía y productos por catálogo, con el fin de obtener ingresos extra. Olga solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido (mecato, productos lácteos, gaseosas); esto le permitirá tener más variedad de productos para satisfacer todas las necesidades y gustos de su clientela y mejorará significativamente sus ingresos. Esto la impulsa a seguir luchando por el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es acreditar y consolidar el restaurante, que sea reconocido en todo el sector y que le permita tener mayor margen de utilidad, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus condiciones de vida, para disfrutar de un mejor futuro a mediano plazo.
texts.en:
Olga, 40, is married and has no children.  She’s currently running her own business:  restaurant where she offers breakfast, lunch, snacks, fried fast-food and soft-drinks.  In this way she earns the income needed to help her husband with the household expenses.

Olga’s an enterprising, active, driven woman who strives tirelessly to give her business continuity.  She works hard shifts from 7am until 8pm.  She alternates this activity with selling products and merchandise via catalog to earn extra income.

Olga is asking for the loan to buy supplies (snacks, dairy products, soft-drinks) to have more variety of products on-hand to meet all needs and customer preferences thus significantly improving her income.  This drives her to continue striving towards her main dream which is to consolidate and make her restaurant well-known throughout the sector so that her profit margin will increase which will hope her improve her living conditions to enjoy a better future in the medium run.

loans.use: to buy packaged snacks, dairy products and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 48 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). Суйумкан имеет среднее образование. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Старший сын работает в швейном цеху, помогает родителям материально, дочь -дошкольного возраста. Роза в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 25 сом (KGS). Опыт в разведении и содержании скота очень большой. Благодаря упорному труду Розы, в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь, 12 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 3,0 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер. Ее сельхоздеятельность приносит около 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Розе увеличить поголовье скота, а также улучшить уровень жизни. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Роза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена накопить денежные средства на проведение свадьбы сына.
texts.en:
Roza is 48 years old, married, and is raising two children (one daughter, one son). She has a high school education. Her husband helps around the farm. The elder son works in a sewing shop and helps his parents financially; the daughter is of preschool age. 

As the main source of income for her family, Roza since 1990 has been engaged in raising livestock and crops, starting this business with 25 som (KGS). She has quite a lot of experience in breeding and raising livestock. Thanks to Roza's hard work, her farm has: one dairy cow, one horse, 12 sheep, and has a plot of land measuring 3.0 hectares on which she grows clover. Her agricultural activities bring in about 16,000 som (KGS) per month, which is the basis of food expenses and household needs for the family. 

Income from the farm allowed Roza to increase the number of livestock, and improve living standards. In order to further develop her farm, Roza turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. 

Roza plans to invest income from the loan to further expand her farm, and in this way intends in the future to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rosalie Govonou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes, qui sont résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Rosalie Govonou (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 28 ans. Rosalie Govonou a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Rosalie Govonou est mariée à un certain Rock. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosalie Govonou vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Rosalie Govonou et son mari assurent ensemble les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Rosalie Govonou vend du riz et de l'huile végétale depuis à son domicile dix ans. Rosalie Govonou s'approvisionne au port du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Rosalie Govonou s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Rosalie Govonou (with her hand raised in the photo), is 28 years old. She has attended secondary school and is married to a man named Rock. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. Rosalie Govonou lives with her husband and children. She and her husband jointly ensure that the household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling rice and vegetables oil out of her home for ten years. She gets her supplies from the port of Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering her business and satisfying customer demands, Rosalie Govonou joined with the other members of her group to request an initial loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase rice and vegetables oil to sell out of her home

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 35-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing plastic side mirror frames of vehicles through an injection molding machine for many years. He buys plastic raw material from the market and puts it into the injection molding machine. The raw material becomes melted under high temperature and then is injected into the dies through compression to give it a specific shape. In this way he manufactures the mirror frames, sells them into the market and makes enough income to contribute to the family's livelihood.

Bushra has three children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is in her third loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy more raw materials for manufacturing so that her husband could increase his sales. She expects a boost in earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of the business.

Bushra is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for molding work.

loans.name: Hamdallah

texts.en:
Hamdallah is a 21-year-old single man from Beit Lahiya (Jabalia). His father works as a construction worker. He gets a low income and barely covers the family's needs. 

Hamdallah is a university student. He studies Arabic literature so that he can become a teacher in the future. Hamdallah took a 550 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. He will be able to write his thesis so that he can graduate next semester. 

Hamdallah's father appears in the photo as he purchased the laptop from the computer store for his son.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Raziya

texts.ru: Разие 54 года, разведена, одна воспитывает 2 сыновей. В 2003 году Разия начала бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 5,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Разия имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Разия смогла увеличить товар в обороте. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Разия обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки продуктов питания с дальнейшей розничной перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Разия планирует вложить в благосостояние своей семьи, а также намерена накопить денежные средства на проведение свадебного торжества младшему сыну.
texts.en:
Raziya is 54 years old, divorced, and is raising two sons on her own. In 2003, Raziya began a business trading food products, using as starting capital an amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Having managed to grow her business and to find loyal customers, Raziya has an average monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work in the business, Raziya was able to increase her turnover of goods. 

In order to further improve and expand her business, Raziya turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the wholesale purchase of food products for further resale at a retail price.

Raziya plans to invest income from the loan in the welfare of her family, as well as plans to save money for her younger son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Chullou B Group

texts.en:
"Hope is a renewable option: If you run out of it at the end of the day, you get to start over in the morning,” says Shani, who is a Nepali by birth, speaks the local dialect and has been married for more than a decade. Untiring effort and relentlessness can be seen with her life venture. She is the featured borrower member and is pictured with her hand raised. 

Shani and the other eight members joined hands and formed the Chullou B Group. “Chullou” signifies “everlasting” in Thadou dialect, and Shani believes in everlasting relationships among the members. She lives in the village with the rest of the group members. The village is about 35 kms away from the capital town of Imphal, which is also one of the Northeastern states in India.

Shani runs a tea-stall in the middle of the area market. She prepares puri (deep-fried bread), toast and tea, and sells them. She is earning well and is happy. The tea-stall is open at the break of dawn and is open until late. The location of the tea-stall gives a lot of advantage for Shani, as the public transport buses and jeep parking is close by, and drivers usually stop at the stall for tea and snacks. The passengers, as well, feed themselves with tea and snacks while waiting for the other passengers to board the vehicle. Passengers start thronging in at the break of dawn, as they wait for the first vehicle to head towards the capital city. 

Chit-chatting with her customers helped Shani acknowledge the need to open a grocery shop in the area. The surrounding villagers typically travel another extra 4 kms to the town market, spending an extra 30 INR as jeep fare, only to purchase essential commodities like salt, soap, cereals, etc. The generated income from running a tea-stall is insufficient to expand the shop with grocery items. 

Shani wants the loan from Kiva to expand her tea-stall with selling grocery items. The plan of expansion of the business is to provide the nearby villagers with groceries and essential items. This will also make extra earnings for her, and helps the villagers to avoid unnecessary traveling to the town market. She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the support. And, says she will repay the loan on time and will continue to build a good relationship with WSDS and Kiva.

The rest of the group members are engaged in a grocery shop, piggery, weaving, clothes-selling, etc.

loans.use: to expand her tea-stall and start selling essential commodities/grocery items for profit.

loans.name: Majd Baysour Group

texts.en:
Sanaa is the featured borrower of Majd Baysour Group, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Sanaa is a 49-year-old married mother of two who has been working in souvenir sales for five years to help her husband cover their family's living expenses. Sanaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to develop her business in a well managed way; in fact she will increase her business merchandise with special souvenir items and accessories.

She hopes that through this loan she will be able to improve and develop her business as much as she can to attract more customers in the future.

Sanaa is the one with the blue shirt at the left. As for the other group members, Mountaha is the one sitting in the middle, and Roweida is on the right.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special souvenir items and accessories

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 28 novembre 2003, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices  revenus. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des valeurs de solidarité qu’elles sont sues renforcer au fur et à mesure qu’elles développent leurs activités. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame  Christine (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère d’un garçon. Très enthousiasme, son activité consiste à la  collecte de noix de cajous auprès des villageois pour la revente à des exportateurs, de même elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme qu’elle achète dans la sous région, qu’elle revend à la capitale par bouteille d’un litre.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter une dizaine de bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palm à 16 000 FCFA le bidon pour la revente par litre à 1 000 F CFA.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices assister son mari dans les tâches quotidiennes et pour le reste renforcer son épargne pour de futurs investissements.
texts.en:
Created on November 28, 2003, the 'banc villageois' is composed of very dedicated women developing revenue-generating businesses. The women all live in the same village and maintain values of solidarity, which they found out how to strengthen while developing their businesses. Their main work is in small-scale commerce along with rainy season farming.

Ms. Christine (sitting at the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower in this group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of one boy. A very enthusiastic woman, has a business that involves collecting cashew nuts from villagers for resale to exporters. She is also a seller of palm oil, which she purchases in the sub-region and sells by the 1-liter bottle in the capital.

Her new loan will enable her to purchase a dozen 20-liter containers of palm oil at 16,000 francs CFA per containers and to resell the oil at 1,000 francs per liter. 

With the profits, she plans on helping her husband with day-to-day tasks, and the rest is for bolstering her savings for future investments.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil to resell

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr: ABOUBAKAR est un jeune homme de 31 ans,père d'un enfant qui fait dans la vente du miel et de l'huile végétale depuis fort longtemps.compte tenue de sa clientèle grandissante au fil des temps et de la petitesse de son stock,il sollicite un crédit pour acheter une une grande quantité de miel et d'huile végétale. ce qui lui permettra d'augmenter ses ventes, de réaliser de grands profits. lesquels lui permettront en retour de bien s'occuper de sa famille et d'agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Aboubakar is a young man, aged 31, who is the father of one child.  He has been selling honey and vegetable oil for a very long time.  Due to the fact that his customer base has increased over time and also because of his small stock of merchandise, he is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of honey and vegetable oil.  This will allow him to increase his sales, which will in turn help him to take good care of his family and expand this activity.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of honey and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 47 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo District with his spouse and two sons. The elder son owns a truck and runs a transportation service business. The younger goes to the local school.  Zaza is involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, he has four milk cows, produces cheese from the milk, and sells it locally. Zaza also grows greens on the plot of land and sells the harvest locally. 

He is very hard-working and the type of person who puts family first.

With this loan, Zaza will purchase all the building materials for the greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Zaza will grow greens and various vegetables. The harvested products will be sold for a good price. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Bernadette est une jeune femme de 34 ans et mère de 04 enfants.elle est propriétaire d'une boutique dans un marché de la place.la petitesse de son capital ne lui permettant pas de gérer  la rupture de stock,elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de matière pastique et autres ustensiles de cuisine. elle pourrait grâce à ce crédit réaliser des bénéfices qui lui permettront de diversifier et agrandir sa boutique. à long terme ,elle compte acquerir la boutique qu'elle loue actuellemen,en plus,elle aimerait participer aux charges financières de sa famille.
texts.en: Bernadette, age 34, is a young mother of four children. She owns a shop at a local market. Unable to cope with a shortage of stock due to her limited funds, she is seeking a loan to stock up on plastic wares and kitchen utensils. This loan could help her to earn enough to expand and diversify her activity. In the long term, she plans to buy the commercial space that she is currently leasing. She also wants to help with the family’s expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on plastic wares and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Ma Remedios

texts.es: Doña Remedios o Doña Reme, como le llaman, vive en un lugar que lleva el nombre de El Oro pues anteriormente se sacaba Oro de las minas, también es un lugar muy conocido por un vagón el cual funciona ahora como un restaurante. Doña Reme platica “Ese vagón solo fue un cachito del tren se quedo ahí pero ahora funciona como  restaurante la gente lo conoce muy bien, lo mejor del lugar son los ricos cafés”  Doña Reme es una mujer  muy trabajadora siempre muy alegre, tiene 46 años de edad está casada con el señor León desde hace 25 años, juntos han formado familia con tres niños uno de ellos aun se encuentra estudiando la secundaria. Doña Reme se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes escolares, desde hace ya 22 años. “Yo trabajaba con un señor que hacia uniformes por eso aprendí, después le enseñe a mi esposo y ahora sabe más que yo, nosotros iniciamos solo con una maquina sencilla, solo elaboramos vestiditos para niñas” Argumento la señora Reme,  poco a poco el taller de costura de Doña Reme fue creciendo gracias a los prestamos de otra financiera dentro mucho tiempo solicitando en esa financiera, cuando se entero de Vision Fund y KIVA decidió  cambiarse. Ahora está solicitando un crédito para comprar tela, hilos, resortes, calcetas, también utilizara su crédito para darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas de costura. El crédito lo utilizo para pagar la tela solo se la dieron fiada ahora ella está muy contenta porque pudo hacer su depósito  pagar su tiempo, también está a muy buen tiempo para poder entregar sus pedidos a tiempo. Los uniformes realizados hasta la fecha son porque sus clientas vinieron ya pedir sus uniformes a Doña Reme le dejan un porcentaje para poder tener la seguridad de vender dicho uniforme. Al parecer no enfrenta ninguna dificultad para sacar adelante su negocio aunque si quisiera tener una bordadora para ya no tener que solicitar este servicio con otras personas, Harán un gran esfuerzo para comprar dicha bordadora para poder así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Remedios, or Reme as she is commonly known, lives in a place know as "El Oro" (The Gold) as it is a former gold mining area. It is also well known because there is a train carriage that is used as a restaurant. Reme tells us "This carriage was just a small part of the train that was left here, but now it functions as a restaurant and people know it well, the best product is the delicious coffees."

Reme is a hard working woman who is always very happy. She is 46 years old and has been married to León for 25 years; they have a family together and have three children, one of whom is still in secondary school.

Reme has made school uniforms for a living for 22 years. "I worked with a man who made uniforms and I learnt from him, then I taught my husband and he knows more than me now. We started working alone with a single machine making little dresses for girls", Reme tells us. Little by little the workshop grew thanks to loans of an alternate finance company for a long time, after a long time with this other company she encountered Vision Fund and KIVA and decided to change. 

Now she is requesting a loan to buy fabric threads and stockings, she will also use the loan to maintain her sewing machines. She used the loan to pay for fabric and proved to be reliable, now she is very happy because she can make her deposit, pay on time and she will be able to deliver her orders on time. The uniforms she has made to date are because her customers came to order their uniforms and paid a deposit so she had the security of selling the uniform when it is made.

It seems that she will have no trouble succeeding with her business although she would like an embroidery machine so she will no longer have to pay others for this service. They will make a great effort to buy the embroidery machine to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, stockings, threads, buttons etc.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 41 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucy is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucy has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mama's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 28 novembre 2003, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées dans le développement d’activités génératrices  revenus. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et entretiennent des valeurs de solidarité qu’elles sont sues renforcer au fur et à mesure qu’elles développent leurs activités. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Mama (assise à droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère six enfants dont trois  garçons et trois filles, elle est âgée  de 42 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits de saison (mangue, liane de pomme « madd », orange, etc.) de plus elle est revendeuse de matière première fer et autres métaux qu’elle collecte auprès des villageois pour la revente aux exportateurs.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter en plus des sacs de « madd », collecter un stock de matière pour la revente.

En plus de renforcer son épargne pour bénéficier de prêt plus important, elle compte soutenir ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Created on November 28, 2003, the 'banc villageois' is composed of very dedicated women developing revenue-generating businesses. The women all live in the same village and maintain values of solidarity, which they found out how to strengthen while developing their businesses. Their main work is in small-scale commerce along with rainy season farming.

Ms. Mama (sitting at the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower in this group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children (three boys and three girls). She is 42 years old and sells seasonal fruits (mangoes, water lemons, 'madd', oranges, etc.). And she is a retailer of raw materials, such as iron and other metals, which she collects from villagers to sell to exporters. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase more sacks of 'madd' and to collect a stock of raw materials to sell.  

In addition to bolstering her savings to obtain a bigger loan, she plans on supporting her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruit, such as 'madd', and to collect raw material to resell

loans.name: Bertrand Peguy

texts.fr: Bertrand Peguy est un homme de 45 ans et père de 04 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 02 et 10 ans. il est propriétaire d'une librerie dans un marché de la place.étant donné que la période des rentées scolaires approches il est confronté à un problème de rupture de stock qui ne puisse pas satisfaire la demande.raison pour laquelle il sollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de papeterie.ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la clientèèle perdue. en plus les bénéfices qui enrésulteront lui permettront de rendre son point de vente olus acttrayant de même que garantir la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en: Bertrand Peguy is a man of 45, father of four children with ages from two to 10 years old. He owns a little stationery shop in a local market. Just as the school year is about to begin again, he is faced with missing inventory that will keep him from satisfying his customers. This is why he is requesting a loan to expand his inventory of paper goods which  will allow him to satisfy his lost clientele. Moreover, the profit that will result from the loan will allow him to make his little shop more attractive and guarantee the school fees for his children.

loans.use: to add to his stock of stationery goods.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is 27 years old and lives in Kapan city. She has a higher education and is a linguist; a specialist of the English language. 

She has worked as a translator for six years, and also gives private English lessons and prepares pupils for the entrance examinations. She is very clever and patient in her work with children, and that is why she is loved and respected by them very much.

Narine asks a loan of 260.000 Armenian drams to buy a computer to use both for her translation activities and during her private lessons as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer to use for her translation activities and during her private lessons

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy meat and pork.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme de 58 ans, mère de 04 enfants. Elle fait dans la vente des fruits (avocats, oranges, mandarines papayes et ananas) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 30 ans.son activité fonctionne bien elle est juste confrontée au problème de rupture de stocks d'où l'insatisfaction dde sa clientèle tout ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en petite quantité à faire tout écouler avant de se réapprovisionner. c'est la raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock de fruits afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante.ceci lui permettra de de réduire la fréquencede ses approvisionnements ainsi qu'agrandir son activité dans le but de la pérénniser.  et de subvenir aux besoins de toute sa famille.
texts.en: Elisabeth is a 58 year old woman and a mother of four children. She has been selling fruits ( avocados, oranges, mandarines, papayas, and bananas, depending on the season) at a market for the past 30 years. Her business is going well, but she is often faced with the challenge of not enough stock. His customers are unsatisfied because of the small amounts of stock she sells due to her lack of capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase larger quantities of fruits in order to satisfy her growing customer base. This will enable her to reduce the number of times she needs to stock up on products, as well as increase her activity with the objective of becoming sustainable and meeting the needs of her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of fruits

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Los Chajones Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario los Chajones, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Gloria Florencia de 35 años de edad, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de productos de consumo diario(tienda)cuando inicio su negocio le costo mucho ya que no tenia mucho capital para trabajar y acudio a Kiva y le ayudaron en su negocio y poco a poco ha hido creciendo, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de granos basicos para la venta, y les agradese por la ayuda que le han brindado y que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en: Gloria Florencia, 35, is a member of the “Los Chajones” Duo.  She’s been working for the last 4 years selling basic staple items (store).  It was very difficult for her when she started her business because she didn’t have much working capital so she called on Kiva and they helped her with the business and it’s gradually grown.  She’s asking for this loan to buy basic staples to sell.  She thanks you for the support she’s gotten and may God bless you.

loans.use: to buy basic staples to sell.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
He is married with four children and lives in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. He has faced so many challenges in life including inadequate finances to effectively carry out his business, the death of family members, sickness in his family, and inadequate finances to educate his children, and provide cothing and a balanced diet for them.
 
He has taken and repaid his loans eight times and says that with this new loan requested, he will buy a new motor bike to be used for public transportation of people, and pay for the bike’s documents. He is positive that his business will succeed because he has been doing it for a long period of time and he has a good rider who will manage the motor bike. With this transportation activity, the community will be transported to and from the farm, farm produce will be transported to the market, students will be transported to and from school and workers will be transported to and from their offices.

With the profit from this loan, he will educate his children with support from his wife, cater to his family's needs like food, clothing and shelter, save to undertake other investments, and help the needy in his community. He prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and the training before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy a motor bike

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel tiene 36 años, casado tiene un hijo pequeño, el se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la zona de  San Basilio  de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Miguel va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, El Sr. Miguel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, El Sr. Miguel es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia. En la fotografía el Sr. Miguel se encuentra en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel is 36 years old, he is married and has a young son. He makes his living selling used clothing at his point of sale which is located in the San Basilio area of the city of Santa Cruz. 

This is loan is part of his first loan cycle with the communal bank. Miguel will use the loan to buy bundles of used clothing for his business, he is seeking the loan due to a lack of capital. Miguel faces challenges in his business as there are many people who perform this activity in the area. He will use the profits to continue improving his sales spot. His dreams for the business are to have a range of stock to offer a variety of products to his customers. Miguel is a hardworking person, he is happy and grateful to the communal bank for the help given as this is the only activity which enables him to support himself and his family. Miguel finds himself in the company of his family in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing for his business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 51, is a small-scale farmer from Kabwe District, Zambia. Ruth has been producing small amounts of cabbage and tomatoes to sell at local markets for more than five years. Currently she waters her crops by hand, drawing water from a well with buckets. She is asking for a Kiva loan so that she may obtain a water pump to be used to irrigate and expand her farm.

Water pumps can be a major boost for small farmers such as Ruth, who struggle to irrigate their crops with buckets during the dry season. A water pump allows for farmers to water their crops more regularly, while also increasing the area they are able to cultivate. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump can be very prohibitive. Once she secures a loan, Ruth will be able to get a water pump from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment to her farm, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it.

With a water pump, Ruth will be able to spend less time watering her crops, while at the same time increase the area to be planted. Ruth hopes to use her profits to further expand her farm and begin producing winter maize, which is a lucrative crop during the dry season.

It is for this reason Ruth is asking Kiva lenders to help her with the loan so that she can secure a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump to irrigate and expand her small vegetable farm

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 28 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines.  Luzviminda requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and for materials to build her pigpens.

Luzviminda has been pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, and for materials to build her pigpens

loans.name: Solidario Princesas Group

texts.es:
Solidario princesas.
Este solidario está conformado por doña  María Juana, ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos la mayor de 12 años y la más pequeña  de 3 años, ella se dedica  a la agricultura sus principales cultivos son siembra de ejote, arveja china, shuchini, y está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de abono y semilla de ejote, ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de seguir invirtiendo y sobre todo ponerle buen abono a sus plantas para que le den buen fruto, ya que solo asi ella podra seguir con sus cultivos y produciendo su buen producto para venderlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Solidario Princesas Group

A group member is María Juana, who is 29 with 4 children, the eldest of whom is 12 and the youngest is 3.

She works in agriculture and her main crops are green beans, Chinese peas and courgette. She is asking for this loan to invest in buying manure and green bean seeds. She is asking for this loan to continue investing, above all in good manure for her plants so they produce good crops. She simply wants to continue farming and producing good products, which she can sell for a good price.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds to sow.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: La Sra. Emiliana tiene 35 años,  casada con cuatro hijos que son de las edades de 15,  13, 8 y 3 años, ella se dedica a la agricultura hace ya bastante tiempo tiene su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad 2 de Mayo,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Emiliana va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de Yuca , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital , la Sra. Emiliana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantener a su familia
texts.en:
Emiliana is 35 years old, married with four children aged 15, 13, 8 and 3. She is a farmer. She has had her plot of land for many years now, located in the "2 de Mayo" community. This is her second loan with Emprender. 

Emiliana will use this loan to buy seed with which to plant yucca. Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital. Emiliana faces challenges in her business such as the climate ruining her crop. This has happened many times. She is grateful for the support given her by Emprender, as this is the only way she has to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant Yucca

loans.name: Wilson's Group

texts.en:
Wilson’s Group is made up of four women who live in the same neighborhood, where the city architecture is a mix of old and new. The women do various trading activities to provide for their families, and they still keep the flames of their culture and traditions alive. The group engages in the sale of scarves, second hand clothing, groceries (spices, noodles, tin tomatoes, etc.), slippers and detergents. This group is a sub-group of 'Akotobu' and standing from the far right is the group leader, who leads the members in group transactions.

One of the group members is Wilson. She is taking her first loan with her friends and fellow members of the group. She is 28, single, and has one child. They live in an apartment.

Wilson has been selling scarves for four years, and it is her main source of income. She works Monday to Friday without a fixed schedule. She is standing second from left in the photograph. 

The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of scarves for sale to customers.

Wilson's goal is to expand her small scale business into giant one.

They need a loan in the total amount of GHS 2,750 .

loans.use: to purcharse scarves for sale to customers.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 49 years old. He is married, with six children. He has spent 30 years in the business of rice farming. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, 50, is a teacher and farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia. For the past 5 years Christopher has been producing fresh maize and large quantities of watermelons that are sold to marketers in the capital city, Lusaka. He is asking for a Kiva loan so that he may obtain a water pump to be used to irrigate and expand his farm.

As a full-time teacher, Christopher has struggled to effectively irrigate his expanding farm. The addition of a water pump will offer a major change as he will be able to move water from his well to his fields in far less time – providing them with much needed water during the dry season. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a water pump are quite prohibitive, even for someone like Christopher, who has an alternative income stream. Once he secures the loan, Rent-to-Own will deliver the pump to his farm and provide Christopher with training on how to properly use and maintain the pump.

With the water pump, Christopher anticipates that he can nearly double his current production of fresh maize and watermelons. He hopes to use his profits to continue to support his children’s school fees and expand the number of chickens his family keeps on the farm.

It is for this reason that Christopher is asking Kiva lenders to help him secure the loan so that he can begin to use a water pump as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Angela's Group

texts.en:
Angela's Group is made up of two Ghanian women, who joined hands to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner ID-Ghana to develop their businesses. 

Angela is the featured borrower of this group; she is a 41-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a 'banku' (cooked corn paste) and fish-seller for five years. This is a local delicacy that is enjoyed by all Ghanians; therefore, it fetches her a good profit. Her business is based on the pavement at the road side.

She is standing on the right-hand side in the picture. Her loan amount of GHS 2,000 will be invested into buying four bags of maize so that she can satisfy her customers very well with her food production business. She sells all day and there is no time limit.

As for the other group member, Vida sells utensils.

loans.use: To buy of four bags of maize so that she can satisfy her customers very well with her food production business.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's Group is in their 3rd cycle with ID-Ghana, where they all work and help each other to succeed.  Mary and David are in good income making businesses, but they need to continue working to maintain their income.  They are from the mother group called 'Onua Do’, and they sell yams, plantains, fresh corn, and African wax-prints. 

One of the group's members is Mary.  Through her effort, continued work, and application of important womanly behaviors, she is improving her family life through trade.  She works by selling fresh corn, plantains, and yams.  Business is doing very well since she is improving her sales.  She is a hardworking person who fights to succeed.

She is requesting this loan of GHS 1,400 to purchase fresh corn, plantains, yams, and vegetables.  She is grateful to Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase fresh corn, plantains, yams, and vegetables.

loans.name: Cornelie

texts.fr: Cornelie est une jeune femme de 33 ans etmère de 01 enfant. elle est vend des arachides caramélisées  dans un marché de la place. compte tenu de la petitesse de son capital,elle est confronté à un problème d'offre très réduite de sa marchandise qui ne puisse pas satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les arachides et du sucre en grande quantité .ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire la clientèle et de réalisre un peu plus de bénéfices. lesquels lui permettront d'accroitre son activité et de s'acheter un terrain pour construire une maison à long terme,de même que assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Cornelie is a young 33-year-old woman and a mother of one child. She sells caramelized groundnuts in a local market. 

Give her lack of capital, she has problems meeting customer demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan in order to buy groundnuts and sugar in bulk. This will allow her to meet customer demand and earn a little more.

These extra earnings will permit her to increase her business and, in the long term, to buy some land to build a house, while at the same time ensuring the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Gladys's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of five members who decided to unite several years ago and join ID-Ghana social micro finance, which has helped them a lot since with their loans as they have been able to improve their small businesses and their quality of life. They are humble people and live off of the little that they earn with their business activities. They dedicate themselves to different activities such as businesses, services and food sales, among other things.

One of the members of this group is Samuel, who is 30 years old, separated, and from this relationship has one child who is 12 years old and in school. 

Samuel is a man who likes to get ahead on the basis of his efforts. He sells eggs and shoes from door-to-door every day. He has several customers who come to his house to buy his products. He has been selling these products for the past two years, and it is going very well.

His loan amount of 2,000 GHS will be used in the purchase of more crates of eggs and shoes. He has been with this microfinance from the beginning of 2011 and this is his 5th loan cycle. He likes it because of the help that the loans have given to him. He is standing on the far right with a crate of eggs in his hand in the photograph. His dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of eggs and shoes to sell to his customers

loans.name: White 2 (1) Group

texts.en: Audrey is one of the members of the group White 2 (1). The group consists of nine female micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Audrey is married with 4 children whose ages range from 15 to 19 years old. Audrey is very excited to be receiving her third loan from HOPE Congo after having successfully paid off her previous loans. She has had her business for around two years. Her business consists of selling foufou (local food), miscellaneous drinks, and fuel. She says her biggest challenge so far in her business is creating customer loyalty. With this next loan she will be able to buy more of each of these items to further grow her inventory. By buying in bulk, she will be able to reduce her prices, giving her a competitive advantage in her bustling stall. Audrey has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that one day she will be able to pay for her children to travel abroad to pursue their university studies. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to pay for stock in her store such as gasoline, drinks, and other miscellaneous food items.

loans.name: Cirila Suyapa

texts.es:
Doña Suyapa es una mujer de 38 años de edad emprendedora y luchadora la cual se desempeña en el hogar realizando actividades hogareñas desde muy temprano por la mañana y además es agricultora especializándose en la siembra y cultivo de maíz, frijol y café. Ella aprendió a trabajar desde muy pequeña ya que a ella le gusto el proceso y procedimiento para cultivar dándose cuenta que no solo era cavar un hoyo y depositar la semilla, si no también, el cuido, abono, limpieza, etc. que lleva para un buen grano. Ella también aprendió a elaborar nacatamales y pan siendo su suegra quien le enseñara y su hija mayor quien la apoya con las ventas de estos productos. Ella es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian en la secundaria 2 en primaria y un menor el cual está en casa. En compañía de su esposo luchan diariamente para poder cumplir su sueño que es el de ver a sus hijos preparados, con carreras universitarias, con un mejor estilo de vida y en un mejor futuro. 

Ella hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento para la compra de productos agrícolas para proteger sus cultivos de café, maíz y frijoles como: 8 bolsas de nutricafe, 7 bolsas de fórmula 18-46-0, 6 bolsas de urea, 7 bolsas de abono foliar y 3 litros de alto 10 SL.
texts.en:
Suyapa, is an enterprising and determined 38 year old women who works at home doing household tasks from the early hours of the morning and is also a farmer specialising in growing corn, beans and coffee. She learned to work from a young age as she enjoyed the process of growing crops, realising that there is more to it then digging a hole and planting a seed - it is also the care, fertilisation, cleaning etc. that produce good crops. She also learnt to make tamales and bread from her mother-in-law and she and her eldest daughter sell these products.

She is a mother of 5 children, of which 2 are in secondary school, 2 are in primary school and the youngest is still at home. Alongside her husband, she works hard daily to fulfill her dream of seeing her children with university educations and a better quality of life and a better future.


Today, she is asking for a loan to buy agricultural products to protect her coffee, corn and beans, such as 8 bags of nutricafe, 7 bags of formula 18-46-0, 6 bags of urea, 7 bags of fertiliser and 3 litres of alto 10 SL.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Beni Group

texts.fr:
Mme RAYANEMANEGRE LUCIE représente le groupe BENI. Mariée, elle mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 01an08mois. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans son secteur. Ses clients sont les voisines.
Elle veut s’acheter 05sacs de charbon de bois et 01rangée de bois de chauffe.
Mme veut réinvestir  ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et ouvrir un salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Mrs. RAYANEMANEGRE LUCIE is the representative of the group BENI. She is married with three children aged 20 months to 8 years old. One child goes to school. 

She has been selling firewood and charcoal for the past five years. She buys her stock locally. Her customer base consists of neighbors. She plans to buy five sacks of charcoal and one pile of firewood.

She wants to reinvest her profits in her activity. Her goals are to provide for her children’s education and open a hair salon.

loans.use: to buy one to five sacks of charcoal and one pile of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Dúo  Solidario Lindo Tecpan Group

texts.es:
DUO LINDO TECPAN
Doña Gregoria es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 29 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta su hija menor de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de laurel y a la crianza de animales.
El esposo de ella trabaja como albañil, gracias al apoyo de el, ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que  con lo que el gana de sueldo ayuda en los gastos de la familia.
El sueño de ella es ampliar su negocio ya que asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y mandar a su hija a la escuela para un futuro mejor, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Laurel para la venta.
texts.en:
DUO LINDO TECPAN (Beautiful Tecpan duo)

Gregoria is a native of Tecpan. She is 29 and has a daughter aged under 18. She makes a living buying and selling laurel and rearing animals.

Her husband works as a bricklayer and, thanks to his support, she can continue with the business because what his earnings help with the family's living costs.

Her dream is to expand her business as this would give her greater profits, and to send her daughter to school for a better future. She is applying for this loan to buy laurel to sell.

loans.use: to buy laurel to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: La Sra. Martina tiene 30 años,  casada con tres hijos que son de las edades de 13, 7 y 2 años, ella se dedica a la agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también yuca en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Villa San Carlos,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Sra. Martina va a utilizar  este préstamo para la compra de semillas para siembra de Yuca   y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, la Sra. Martina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios para mejorara la calidad de vida de la cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que las veces que saca el crédito lo utiliza para la siembra de sus productos ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene , una vez que cosecha sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de la comunidad Directamente del productor al consumidor.
texts.en:
Martina, is 30 years old and married with three children aged 13, 7 and 2. She works in agriculture, sewing a variety of vegetables like yucca in her plot of land in the community of Villa San Carlos.

This loan is her first within this institution, Martina will use the loan to buy Yucca seeds and items for preparing the land. Her reason for requesting the loan is so she can buy resources for planting her crops and also survive. 

Martina faces challenges in her business because of the climate which can ruin her crops. She will use the earnings to improve the quality of life for her customers and her family as she must pay for the household expenses.

She is a responsible and hard working person and is grateful for the support offered by the institution, as she can occasionally request a loan to help plant her crops, which are her only source of income. Once she harvests her products she sells them at the local market - direct from the producer to the consumer.

loans.use: to buy Yucca seeds and prepare the land.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma es una madre soltera de 24 años de edad la cual es ama de casa y agricultora, una mujer muy trabajadora y visionaria madre de 3 hijos los cuales el mayor está en el kínder y 2 menores de 4 y 3 años. Tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio gracias al apoyo financiero de sus padres. Ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol lo cual aprendió de sus padres desde muy temprana edad siendo en su familia la agricultura una tradición. El terreno que ella cultiva es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres en el cual se involucran solo familiares. Su mayor y más grande sueño es dar a sus hijos lo que ella no tuvo en su juventud la oportunidad de estudiar a nivel superior para prepararlos y hacerlos personas de bien, provechosas, mejorando su calidad de vida y enfrentando los problemas económicos de manera favorable.

Es por ello que diariamente lucha para poder ver a sus hijos graduados y dejarles un patrimonio fortalecido y un terreno donde ellos con el tiempo puedan construir. Para eso ella ha solicitado un financiamiento en la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 8 bolsas de nutrí café, 5 bolsas de abono 18-46-0, 8 bolsas de urea, 5 bolsas de foliar, 2 litros de alto 10 SL y 4 bolsas de abono 12-24-12 con el cual asistirá a sus cultivos y dará una mejor y mayor protección para que al final de la cosecha sea un éxito
texts.en:
Norma is a single mother of 24 years of age, a housewife and family. She is a very hardworking and visionary mother to three children, the oldest of which is in kindergarten and the two young ones ages 3 and 4 years old. She has a complete primary education which she was able to attend with a lot of effort and sacrifice thanks to the financial support of her parents. 

She makes her living growing corn and beans which she learnt from her parents at a very young age given that agriculture is a tradition in her family. The plot of land that she cultivates is her own thanks to an inheritance from her parents in which only relatives are involved. Her biggest dream is to give her children who she didn't have in her youth, the opportunity to study to a high level to prepare them and turn them into good people, profitable, improving her quality of life and facing financial problems in a positive light. This is why every day she fights to see her children become graduates and leave them a healthy inheritance and a plot of loan where they can build over time.

To do so, Norma is seeking financing from the Comixmul cooperative with which she will by 8 bags of coffee nutrients, 5 bags of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 8 bags of urea, 5 bags of foliage, 2 liters of Alto 10 SL fungicide and 4 bags of 12-24-12 manure with which she will tend to her crops and give improved protection so that ultimately the harvest is a success.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops of basic grains.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Remedios Group

texts.es:
Las 19 integrantes cuentan con actividades comerciales variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan por ir mejorando, y por medio de las capacitaciones ir haciendo que sus trabajos estén cada vez mejor.
La señora Gertrudis es la presidenta del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace, y lo cual según comenta gusta mucho a sus clientes. Es una persona muy hábil con lo que hace y es por eso que le va muy bien. Ella invertirá su crédito en la compra de verduras y carne, etc. para la venta de comestibles.
Todas estan muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que estan recibiendo, ya que con el trabajo en grupo pueden ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The 19 members work in a variety of commercial activities.  Each one makes an effort to continue improving.  With training their jobs are getting better all the time.

Gertrudis is the president of the communal bank.  She makes a living selling food that she makes herself.  According to what she says, her customers like it a lot.  She's very clever with what she does, which is why it's going so well for her.

She'll invest her loan in buying vegetables and meat, etc., so she can sell her food.

All the members are very grateful for this opportunity because they can help their families by working with the group.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es:
La señora Olga María reside en el municipio de condega una pequeña ciudad al norte de Nicaragua, aproximadamente unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, esta señora es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que trabajan por cuenta propia y le ayudan económicamente para sufragar sus gastos personales. Esta señora tiene unos 48 años de vivir en su propia casa de habitación y es muy conocida por los vecinos.
La señora Olga es empleada y labora para una institución publica en el municipio de condega en el área de vigilancia, ella tiene aproximadamente unos 8 años de laborar en esta área. Ella labora a diario todos los días de la semana sin horario ya que tiene que estar pendiente del cuido de dicho parque.
ella se presentó a ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para ser beneficiaria de un proyecto que impulsa ceprodel que consiste en sistema sanitario de agua y saneamiento que dicho perfil es mejorar la salubridad de la población de condega, ella se muestra positiva que podrá ser beneficiada con este proyecto e ir mejorando las condiciones de su casa ya que sus ingresos mensuales no le son suficiente como para poder costear los gastos de dicha construcción por cuenta propia y de esta manera lograr tener una vivienda más digna.
texts.en:
Olga María lives in the town of Condega, a small city in the north of Nicaragua approximately 35 kilometers north of Estelí.  She's a single mother with two children who work on their own and help her pay for her personal expenses.  She has lived in her own house for some 48 years and is very well known to the neighbors.

Olga works for a public institution in city of Condega.  She has worked in this field for approximately eight years.  She works every day of the week without a schedule because she has to look after the care of the park.

She went to CEPRODEL to request a loan for a project inspired by CEPRODEL.  It consists of a sanitary water system, the goal of which is to improve the health of the people of Condega.

She's positive she'll be able to benefit from this project and continue improving her housing conditions, because her monthly income isn't enough to pay for the construction on her own.  This way she'll have a better house.
