loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia es una mujer de 31 años, esta casada con Marcelino y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Hace 10 años Celia se inició como agricultora de los productos más rentables que crecen en su zona en un terreno de 2 hectáreas que le cedieron sus padres cuando asumió su compromiso con su esposo. La agricultura es una actividad muy sacrificada pero desde sus inicios le ayuda a mantener económicamente a su familia teniendo el  firme apoyo de su esposo. Celia se dedica a cultivar cacao orgánico seguido de barbasco y algunos árboles frutales. Para facilitar las labores que realiza contrata constantemente a trabajadores del lugar a quienes paga todos lo días. Comenta que siempre debe contar con capital de trabajo para invertir en sus plantaciones y desarrollar sin contratiempos la correspondiente campaña productiva. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es vender las almendras de cacao secas a los acopiadores del lugar ya que recibe el pago correspondiente de manera inmediata y recupera el dinero que invirtió con las respectivas ganancias. Tiene muchos objetivos a largo plazo siendo uno de ellos apoyar a sus hijos cuando sean jóvenes para que logren ser profesionales. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Celia is a 31 year old woman, married to Marcelino. They have 3 children with whom they live in their adobe house. 10 years ago Celia started farming the most profitable products. She grows them on a two hectare plot that was given to her by her parents when she got married. Farming is a very demanding activity but since the beginning it has helped her provide for her family, with the support of her husband. 

Celia grows organic cocoa, followed by barbasco (native tropical American plant) and a few fruit trees. In order to keep up with the work they constantly hire local labor, paid by the day. Celia says that she needs working capital to invest in her plantations and successfully manage the growing season. What she enjoys most about her work is selling the dried cocoa beans to the local buyers, as she gets paid immediately and gets back the money she has invested. She has many long term goals, one of them being able to support her children while they are young so they can grow up to be professionals.

This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support so she can move forward. She promises to pay her installments in a timely fashion. This loan is for 2,000 PEN so she can buy organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy red bricks, metal sheeting, cement, corrugated iron bars, smooth iron bars and support beams.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco de 38 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, él trabaja en un mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia como ayudante de venta de sandias con lo que obtiene de su pago logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, marco está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Marco is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages 15 and 13.  They live in their own home, but it does not have electricity.  Marco works at a market near his home, where he is an assistant in charge of selling watermelons.  With the money he earns, he is able to pay for some of his household expenses.  

Marco is requesting a loan in order to buy a solar lamp since he would not be able to do so with what he earns.  The lamp is also a charging station that is powered by energy from solar panels.  These types of lamps are useful in homes in rural areas that don’t receive electricity.  By purchasing this lamp, Marco and his family will benefit since they will be able to have light during the night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Balles Group

texts.es:
DUO LIRIO DE LOS VALLES 

Dúo conformado por dora carmelita, originaria de San Martin jilotepeque un área en el que se comercializa mucho la agricultura y los tejidos típicos y ella lo ha sabido aprovechar, ya que ella se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a la elaboración de tejidos típicos, ella es una Persona que ha mostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en: Dora Carmelita is part of the Duo Lirio de los Valles.  She is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque, an area known for agriculture and traditional fabrics, which she takes advantage of since she has worked making traditional fabrics for more than five years.  She is a person who has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.  She is requesting this loan to purchase primary materials to make traditional fabrics to sell.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Mebakari

texts.en:
Mebakari operates a business selling coconuts at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the 10,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Sandra es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de 5 hijos los cuales viven en su casa 2 están en la escuela y uno de los 3 restante ayuda en las actividades del campo. Con 4 años de educación primaria ella lucha diariamente en compañía de su esposo para que sus hijos no pasen por la misma situación que ella en su juventud paso apoyándoles en todo lo que puede y no necesario para que a ellos no les falte nada. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café, maíz y frijol desde muy joven teniendo mucha experiencia en el cultivo de estos productos. La tierra que en compañía de su esposo y su hijo trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia y otra parte comprada la cual está ubicada a una distancia de 30 minutos de camino en la cual solo ellos como familia se involucran.

Sus metas y sueños son las de darle a sus hijos una buena educación un buen futuro con el cual ellos puedan tener como la mejor arma para el día de mañana. Es por ello que ella lucha día a día y hoy ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 45 latas de café en pergamino, 13 quintales de urea 5 quintales de fertilizante 12-24-12 para poder darle un excelente y satisfactorio mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café ya que los ingresos para su familia dependen de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Sandra is a farmer and housewife, the mother of 5 children, all of them living at home. Two of them are attending school and one of the remaining three helps with the work in the fields. With only 4 years of primary education, Sandra struggles daily, together with her husband, so that the children do not suffer the same situation that she suffered in her youth. She supports them as much as she is able and provides the essentials so that they do not lack anything. 

She has worked growing coffee, corn and beans since she was very young and she has a lot of experience in the cultivation of these products. The land that she, her husband and their son work is their own, part of it received as an inheritance. Another part, located a 30 minute walk away, is purchased and worked only by herself and her family. 

Her goals and dreams are to give her children a good education, which is the best tool they can have for a good future. It is for this that she works every day. Presently, she has requested financing from the COMIXMUL cooperative in order to buy 45 cans of Pergamino coffee, 13 quintals (about 1300 lbs) of urea, and 5 quintals (about 500 lbs) of 12-24-12 fertilizer in order to provide high quality and sufficient maintenance to her coffee crops, since the family income depends on this activity.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Ziada, who was born in the late 1970s, is married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. The youngest is still a baby. For two years now, Ziada has been running two enterprises: a food shop and a business selling clothes door-to-door. Ziada works from 8:00am to 8:30pm daily and is able to earn a fair income per month. She is looking forward to growing her business returns in order to improve her life by having better accommodations.
 
This is Ziada's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more business inventory, like food items and clothes to resell. Ziada dreams that one day she will be able to build a nice house. She will share this loan with her loan group "Faith," which totals 13 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more food items and clothes for resale

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza es un grupo trabajador de la ciudad de Caacupé, donde todas y cada una de ellas está haciendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Laura es parte de este grupo, es una humilde mujer, quien por medio de la venta de remedios yuyos (hierbas naturales) está dando a su familia lo que tiene a su alcance. Ella es una persona que se está esforzando por salir adelante e ir mejorando día a día.
Ella solicita hoy de esta ayuda para poder seguir con sus ventas y poder comprar hierbas naturales para la venta. Ellas agradecen por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder mejorar sus vidas.
texts.en:
La Esperanza is a hardworking group from the city of Caacupé.  Each and every one of them is making her greatest effort to keep on improving her living conditions.

Laura's part of the group.  She's a modest woman who sells natural herbal remedies to give her family everything she can.  She's making an effort to get ahead and improve every day.

She's currently requesting this loan to continue with her sales and be able to buy natural herbs to sell.

They're grateful for this opportunity to improve their lives.

loans.use: to buy natural herbs

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: DOÑA ROSA LLEVA YA MAS DE TRES AÑOS RECIBIENDO EL APOYO DE FAPE Y KIVA, AGRADECE LA AYUDA. ELLA SE HA DEDICADO A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y COMO TRABAJO SECUNDARIO SE DEDICA A TEJIDOS TIPICOS, EN EL CREDITO QUE FINALIZO TUVO VARIOS DIAS DE ATRAZO PERO FUE POR MOTIVO DE ENFERMEDAD, SE LOGRO PONER AL DIA Y ASI MISMO SEGUIR ADELANTE EN SU NEGOCIO. JUNTO A SU ESPOSO HAN PROCREADO CUATRO NIÑOS Y ESO ES EL MOTOR QUE LOS IMPULSA A SEGUIR ADELANTE Y LUCHANDO POR LA VIDA. SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE POLLOS, CONCENTRADO Y VITAMINAS, ESPERA QUE NUEVAMENTE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en:
Rosa has received support from Kiva and from FAPE for three years and she is grateful for the support. Her main line of work is the raising of chickens, and her secondary work consists of making traditional weavings.  The credit she recently completed was a few days late due to illness, but she has gotten caught up and wishes to continue moving her business forward.  She and her husband have four children together and they are the engine that drives them to get ahead and keep fighting through life.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of additional chickens, food pellets, and vitamins. She is hoping that she will once again receive the assistance requested from this loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens, food pellets, and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Unidos Lucharemos Group

texts.es:
DUO UNIDOS LUCHAREMOS

este dúo está conformado por Lilian Elizabeth de 31 años de edad es originaria de san Martin  jilotepequé , Lilian se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, como lo son pollos, gallinas, patos y pavos el área por donde viven es apropiado para la crianza de estos animales y también esa clase de animales som muy comercializada ella es muy responsable y  esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de animales para la crianza ya que ella necesita invertir mas para tener un mejor ingreso, y tambien aprovechando la demanda que tiene de sus clientes, esperando que por medio de kiva ella puedan seguir progresando en su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO UNIDOS LUCHAREMOS ("Duo Together We Fight")

One of the members of this duo is Lilian Elizabeth, 31 years old from San Martin Jilotepequé. Lilian works raising poultry such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys. There is high demand for these animals, which she raises where she lives. Lilian is very responsible and is asking for this loan in order to buy more animals to raise. She needs to invest more in order to earn more, and expects to take advantage of the demand that she has from her existing clients. With the help of Kiva, she hopes to continue progressing with her business.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise (chickens, ducks, and turkeys)

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque  requiere de más capital trabajo para la elaboración  de tamales y comida; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: hojas, pollo, carne, aceite, maíz, condimentos, leña, entre otros.
El crédito anterior ayudo de manera positiva, ya que logro adquirir los artículos necesarios y fortalecer el negocio. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen y sus ingresos han mejorado. Su deseo es adquirir su propio local, agregar otro tipo de rubro, asimismo construir su propia vivienda; ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juana is requesting a new loan because she requires capital for her business, making tamales and other prepared foods. This loan will help her buy materials and ingredients, such as: leaves, chicken, meat, oil, corn, condiments and firewood, among others.

A previous loan helped her to buy utensils and to improve her business. Her family situation has been stable and her income has risen. Her wish is to buy her own premises for her shop, expand into a different business line, and to build her own home. By doing so she hopes to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To buy leaves, chicken, meat, oil, corn, condiments and firewood, among others.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married. She has a business buying and selling fruits in the Philippines.

Marilyn requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fruits like oranges, mangoes, avocados, apples, etc. to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits like oranges, mangoes, avocados, apples, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto es originario de la ciudad de León, padre de 3 hijos.  Se dedica a la venta  de productos perecederos que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a delante desde hace  20 años. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso el negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos; junto al apoyo que le brinda su familia. Solicita el crédito para comprar: tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, frutas, verduras y legumbres con el fin de satisfacer necesidades de sus clientes. Su meta futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y con el tiempo poner una pulpería en su sector.
texts.en: Rigoberto's from the city of León and has three children.  He has sold perishables for 20 years and has managed to get ahead with a lot of sacrifice and effort. His other source of income is raising pigs . Together, these help support his family. He's requesting the loan to buy tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, fruits, vegetables, and legumes to satisfy his customers' needs. His goal for the future is to improve the infrastructure of his business and, in time, set up a grocery store in his area.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes

loans.name: Mariama Thiedo's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’être aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons et une fille. Elle tient une  boutique dans sa maison où elle vend divers produits de consommation courante, qu’elle achète en gros au marché central pour la revente au détail.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte deux à trois cartons de spaghetti, deux cartons de couscous et des ingrédients en vu de servir sa clientèle lors de la fête.

Les bénéfices lui permettront en plus de consolider son épargne, d’appui son mari dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, created on July 16, 2012, is composed of women who are very engaged and eager to achieve success in their business. They have a team spirit and are ready to help each other. They all live in the same neighborhood and work mainly as vendors.
Mrs. Mariama (the one seated on the far right raising her right hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of three: two sons and one daughter. She has a shop in her home where she sells groceries. She stocks up wholesale at the central market in order to sell retail. 
With her new loan, she plans to [buy] two or three boxes of pasta, two boxes of couscous and other cooking ingredients in order to offer them to her customers during the holiday season. Her earnings will allow her to bolster her savings and  help her husband  with the school costs for their children.

loans.use: two or three boxes of pasta, two boxes of couscous and other cooking ingredients in order to offer them to her customers during the holiday season.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia de 39 años de edad, está casada con Raimundo quien es padre de sus hijos, juntos viven en su casa construida a base de adobe. Aurelia es agricultora y aprendió este oficio gracias a sus padres quienes desde muy niña le inculcaron está actividad familiar de manera honrada. Es así que creció en el campo con los conocimientos del caso y al cumplir 18 años se comprometió y tuvo a su primer hijo viéndose obligada a independizarse de sus padres y empezar una nueva vida al lado de su esposo. Tras 4 años de trabajo como jornaleros lograron adquirir una parcela de 2 hectáreas donde se iniciaron en la producción de cacao, barbasco, entre otros. Se siente muy identificada con esta labor ya que le ayudo mucho a mantener económicamente a su familia y tras 21 años de trabajo constante se siente hasta hoy muy motivada y con muchos objetivos por cumplir. La venta de barbasco se ha convertido también en una buena fuente de ingreso porque posee un buen precio en el mercado. Para todas las labores que realiza trata de contar siempre con la ayuda de trabajadores del lugar esperando finalizar las tareas pendientes en un menor periodo y de manera uniforme.
Uno de sus principales objetivos construir su vivienda a base de material noble esperando mejorar su calida de vida y sabe que solo será posible con mucho esfuerzo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea solicitar 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de cacao y así incrementar sus plantaciones y por consiguiente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 39, is married to Raimundo who is the father of her children, they live together in her home built with adobe. Aurelia is a farmer and she learnt this trade through her parents who introduced her to this family activity from a young age in an honest way. This explains how she grew up in the countryside with knowledge of the trade, and when she turned 18, she got engaged and had her first son meaning that she had to become independent from her parents and start a new life alongside her husband.

After four years of working as laborers, they managed to buy a two hectare plot of land where they started to produce cacao and barbasco among other crops. Aurelia feels she can identify with this work as it has helped her a lot to financially support her family and, after 21 years of constant work, she stills feels highly motivated to this day and has a lot of objectives to accomplish. The sale of barbasco has also proved an excellent source of income as it fetches a good price in the market. For all the work that she performs, she always tries to count on the help of workers in the area to finish tasks pending in a shorter period of time and in a uniform manner.

One of Aurelia's main objectives is to build her own home with good quality materials, she hopes to improve her quality of life and knows that this will only be possible with a lot of effort. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead in life. She also pledges to meet the repayments in a punctual manner. 

On this occasion, Aurelia is seeking 2,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy cocoa plants and increase her plantations and as such her income.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past three years, Monica has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells sugar, salt, Omo. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase Omo, sugar and salt for the shop to sell, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and look after her family. Monica hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Monica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase Omo, sugar and salt to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a street vending food business, selling doughnuts to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With this loan of Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for the food preparation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 70 years old and married with seven children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business of buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more dried coconut meat to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this dried coconut meat retail business for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains and farming coconut.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 30 años y está casada y vive junto a sus hijos en su casa propia construida a base de adobe. Delia se dedica a la agricultura y al campo desde que fue una niña por herencia de sus padres y abuelos. Comparte el agrado de trabajar junto a su esposo quien es su principal apoyo.Su principal objetivo según comenta, es tratar que sus plantaciones de cacao broten mazorcas de buena calidad ya que es la única manera de obtener un buen precio por ellas. Al vivir en un pueblo algo distante de sus terrenos debe de madrugar todos los días y atender a sus hijos para enviarlos al colegio y luego iniciar sus labores agrícolas. En ocasiones se presentan días lluviosos que dificultan las vías de acceso a su centro de trabajo así como sus labores viéndose obligada a darlo como día atrasado. Para la próxima campaña productiva desea renovar 3 cuadras de cultivo y reemplazar los árboles de cacao que están desfasados y sin la posibilidad de seguir produciendo. Le gusta contar con capital de trabajo disponible ya que es la única manera de llevar una correcta producción cubriendo las necesidades que suele cubrir una producción cacaotera. Desea con el tiempo comprar una parcela de 4 cuadras para iniciarse en la producción de barbasco ya que es un producto que tiene muy buena demanda. Es su primer préstamo solicitado ante su entidad financiera y espera contar con la confianza necesaria porque mientras más capital de trabajo tenga disponible obtendrá mejores resultados. En esta ocasión deseA solicitar un préstamo de 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de plantas de cacao y proceder con el reemplazo de los árboles malogrados.
texts.en:
Delia is 30 years old, married, and lives with her children in the house she owns built from adobe.  Delia has worked in agriculture and in the fields since she was a girl and learned from her parents and grandparents.  She shares the work with her husband, who is her main support.  She says her main objective is to ensure that her cacao plants sprout good quality pods, since that is the only way to get a good price for them.  

Since she lives in a town far from her fields, she has to get up at dawn every day and get her children ready to go to school and later start her farm work.  On occasion, rainy days make the roads that access her fields difficult to pass, so her work has to be a day late.  For the next growing season, she wants to renovate three blocks and replace the older cocoa trees that are no longer producing.  She likes to have working capital available since the only way to have a good production is to cover the items that are needed during a cocoa harvest.  In time, she wants to purchase a parcel of four blocks to start planting mullein since it is a product in high demand.  

This is her first loan requested from a financial institution and she hopes to have the necessary confidence because with more working capital available, she will obtain better results.  She is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase cocoa plants and start to replace the failed trees.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado El Progreso está en su primer Ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Son justamente mujeres que están luchando por su progreso, y es por ello que están luchando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Angela, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa,  se encuentra mejorando su emprendimiento y así ayuda a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica la venta de forma ambulante de prendas variadas, y que así se ha hecho conocida con su clientela, hoy ya variada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas para la venta y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
El Progreso Group is in its first loan cycle with the women's committee, in which they all work and help each other mutually to get ahead.  They're women who are striving to make progress.

One of the members is Angela, who's improving her business and helping her family with effort and constant work and by applying the vital characteristics of a successful woman.  She says that, among the jobs she does, she earns a living as a street vendor selling a variety of clothes.  She has become known to her customers and now has a varied clientele.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying clothing to sell.  This way she can continue selling, just as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is 67 years old, single, and works hard to help her nephews.

She has a pig raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Maximina is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens for her pig raising business.

Maximina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her pig pens

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres En Accion De San Martin Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES EN ACCION DE SAN MARTIN

Dúo conformado por doña Juana de 38 años de edad ell es originaria de San Martin jilotepeque. Doña Juana se dedica a la crianza de cerdos Y pollos, es madre de familia y tiene 2 hijos y lucha día a día por darle lo mejor a sus hijos. este es el segundo crédito que solicita porque quieren comprar más animales para la crianza y engorde, ella le pone muchas ganas a su trabajo ya que ha encontrado en el, una fuente de ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su familia espera que nuevamente se le pueda ayudar con el credito.
texts.en:
One of the members of the "Duo Mujeres en Accion de San Martin" group is Juana who is 38 years old and is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. Juana raises pigs and chickens. She is the mother of a family of two children and she struggles daily to provide the best for her children. 

This is her second loan. She has requested it to buy more animals to raise and fatten. Juana enjoys her work and from it has found a source of income to pay her family's daily expenses. Once again she hopes to be able to count on the support of this loan.

loans.use: to buy animals for rearing.

loans.name: Narcefa

texts.en:
Narcefa is 46 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming corn and rice in the Philippines. Narcefa is borrowing 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Narcefa has been farming corn and rice for one year. She also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is married and has two children. Both of her children are too young to go to school. The family lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Regina operates a retail shop that sells various items such as soap, cooking oil, and sugar. Her major challenge is transportation. With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase beans, rice, cooking oil, soap, and sugar for resale. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, cooking oil, soap, and sugar for resale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 27 years of age and lives in Dansoman-Accra. She is married and she has two children. She runs a retail shop in the area where she lives and this has been her major activity for the last five years. She does this work all by herself.

She wants a loan amount of 1,500 Ghana Cedis (GHS) to buy more wigs of different brands to sell to customers. The major challenge that she faces is price instability and inflation. This her fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana and she has repaid previous loans without difficulty. The extra income that she will raise from the loan will be used to pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more wigs of different brands to sell to customers.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional items for hair treatment, hair color, etc. for her beauty parlor business.

Melinda has been in this business for 5 years. Melinda earns more income from selling ready-to-wear.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items for hair treatment, hair color, etc. for her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 3 ellas han hecho la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como medio de conocer como esta cada una en sus ingresos y en su vida en general. Todas son mujeres jefas de familias que quieren salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Shirley es una persona digna de destacar, quien además de formar parte del grupo, es la presidenta, y comenta que siempre las insta a seguir luchando y  de esa forma no desanimarse. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se dedica a la venta de joyas de toda clase, como ser cadenas, pulseras, anillos demás, en lo que se está abriendo camino  ya que tiene muy buena clientela, hace sobre pedidos y así está teniendo los ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas de toda clase, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Activas Group is in its third loan cycle.  They have completed the poverty-elimination survey as a means of finding out where each one stands in her income and her life in general.  All the women are heads of family who want to get ahead and help their families.

Shirley's a person worthy of highlighting.  In addition to being a member of the group, she's the president.  She says she always urges them to continue striving so they don't get discouraged.

Shirley's a very hardworking person who earns a living selling all types of jewelry, such as necklaces, bracelets, rings, and other items.  She's making her own way because she has very good customers, she orders on request, and she has the income to help her family.

She's requesting this loan to invest in buying all types of jewelry.  This way she can continue with her sales and fill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Olive Shg Group

texts.en:
With sweat on her face and hands, Nichoibong says, “It is not easy to run a tea-stall in summer,” and heaves a sigh. Nichoibong is short in height, studied until primary level, and runs a tea-stall for her income. Her tea-stall is also captured in the picture where the group member stands in the front of the tea-stall. She belongs to Olive SHG Group and is the featured borrower member for the group. She is pictured with her hand raised. 

All the members live in the same village, and all are engaged in income-generating activity. The group was formed to encourage, motivate and be financially independent. The village is about 30 kms away from the main town of Imphal, and it is also one of the capital states in the northeastern states of India.

Nichoibong has been running the tea-stall for more than a couple of years, and before this she used to grow chives and sell them. The tea-stall is in the front yard of her house, and it is built with a tin roof, knotted bamboo and no concrete flooring. 

The tea-stall is open at the break of the dawn and closes down at sunset. She sells tea, toast and puri (fried flatbread) in the morning. Most of the time she uses firewood and charcoal for heating, as the liquefied petroleum gas is expensive. The firewood is sometimes collected by herself from the nearby fields to save some income. She usually gets the supplies from the main city market, and she also purchases on credit from the village grocery shop. 

Nichoibong prepares good tea with tasty puri and toast, which is the main attraction for the villagers. People buzz in during the early morning to have tea and puri for breakfast. At daybreak, elders hang out at the stall and kill time. Farmers also stop at the tea-stall in the evening when they return from the field to have a cup of tea. Her warm and humble nature attracts people to sit and have tea at the stall. 

The generated income is mostly used to manage the family expenses, and the case gets worse when the credit repayment from customers fails. 

Nichoibong wants the loan to purchase bags of flour and wheat, milk powder, edible oil and extra gas. With the stock list, she will be able to run the business efficiently without worrying about the next day. She will open an account and start monthly savings for the future, and also repay the loan on time. She is happy that Kiva and WSDS create a platform for women who need financial support, and she wishes them good luck.

The rest of the group members are also engaged in a piggery, vegetable-selling, poultry, etc.

loans.use: to purchase bags of wheat and flour, edible oil, and stock for her tea-stall.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a single woman without children. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For the past four years, Mwaka has operated a clothes-selling business, selling women's clothes, children's clothes, and men's clothes. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 43 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Williams Alberto

texts.es: Williams, tiene 33 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y  vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. el se dedicaba a trabajar en empresa privada pero al quedar sin empleo decidió establecer su propio negocio para obtener ingresos para su familia. El negocio lo tiene en un local que renta desde hace un año. Ofrece granos básicos, abarrotes, refrescos, productos lácteos, jugos, huevos por cartón y otros. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF que es por 25,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, carnes, lácteos, refrescos, dulces y churros para vender en su negocio. Su objetivo es incrementar sus ingresos para llegar a tener un minisúper y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Williams is 33 years old, married with three children, and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlantida. He had been working in a private business, but when he became unemployed he decided to open his own business to make an income for his family. The business is located in a building he has been renting for a year, and he sells basic grains, groceries, soft drinks, dairy products, juices, and eggs by the carton, among other products. 

He is requesting a second loan of 25,000 lempiras from ODEF in order to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, candy, and fried snacks to sell in his store. His goal is to increase his earnings so that in future he can have a small supermarket and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, dairy products, soft drinks, candy, and fried snacks to sell in his store

loans.name: Babine Chantal

texts.fr: Babine est une femme camerounaise de 40 ans. mère d'un enfant de 10 ans qui va à l'école, elle vends les vêtements pour enfant et adulte dans un marché de la ville depuis près de 11 ans. Ne disposant pas d'un stock assez consistant de marchandises, Babine souhaite avec l'argent du crédit augmenter son stock de vêtement de bébé et adulte. les bénéfices obtenus seront réinjectés dans l'activité et permettront également à Babine d'assurer l'avenir de son fils.
texts.en: Babine is a Cameroonian woman who is 40 years old and mother to a 10-year old child who goes to school. For almost 11 years she has been selling children's and adults' clothing in a market in town. As she does not have a sufficiently large stock, Babine would like to use her loan to increase her supply of baby and adult clothes. The profits she makes will be reinjected into her business and will at the same time enable her to provide for her son's future.

loans.use: to increase her supply of baby and adult clothes

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en:
Faridah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her fresh food business.

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce, like Irish potatoes, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits, educate her children, and with home care. Faridah hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house on her plot. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more produce, like Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase matooke and irish for selling, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and buy new items for her house. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to earn a good living and also build a very big residential house. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase matooke and irish for selling

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and a mother of five children who attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

Fatuma sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruit and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jessica Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jessica de 27 años de edad, casada con un hijo, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Jessica es una mujer trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia, y le prepara platos típicos como el Nacatamal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos de hogar. Y lo cual lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a su espíritu y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, de forma ambulante, cargando un bulto de unos 20 kg diariamente ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes por encargo.  Ella dedica a su actividad unas 8 horas diaria, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio con mercadería como pantalones, blusas, short, faldas, ropa de cama, ropa interior, sabanas, jugos de toallas. Vestidos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jessica agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kvia les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 27, is married with one child. She is originally from León, which is located in the western part of the country. Jessica is a hardworking and responsible woman with a desire to better herself. In her free moments she likes to enjoy the company of her family and prepare for them traditional dishes such as Nacatamal [Nicaraguan tamales prepared with cornmeal, meat and rice, wrapped in a banana leaf]. Lamentably, she wasn’t able to obtain a professional degree and found herself needing to work from an early age to help with household expenses. And so she fights day-to-day to give her  children a better future.

Thanks to her spirit and her desire to get ahead, she has as her business the sale of general merchandise.  Working as a street vendor, carrying a load of about 20 kilos everyday, she offers her products to her customers by advance order. She dedicates 8 hours daily to her business, an activity that she carries out gladly. The objective of her loan is to invest in business capital and stock her business with merchandise such as pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, bedclothes, underwear, sheets, towel sets, and dresses. This is so that in the not-too-distant future she can achieve a better income. Jessica appreciates the help that Kiva investors offer to people with scant resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her merchandise with products such as pants, blouses, shorts, skirts, bedclothes, underwear, sheets, towel sets, and dresses.

loans.name: Becker

texts.es: Becker es un joven de 21 años muy trabajador, es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres. Desde muy joven se caracterizo por ser trabajador, inicialmente apoyaba a sus padres en el campo pero años después decidió salir a la ciudad y se inició como mesero en un restaurante y en otros oficios similares. Actualmente tiene planeado abrir un negocio dedicado a la venta de pollos a la braza ya que por el momento no existen comercios similares y considera que sería una buena oportunidad para iniciarse de manera independiente . Tiene la suerte de contar con un local que pertenece a su madre ubicado en el primer piso de su vivienda y espera a la vez generar empleo para algunas personas en su localidad. Su principal objetivo a largo plazo es abrir un negocio similar en la capital de su distrito esperando iniciarse como un pequeño micro empresario para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y desea contar con su apoyo financiero para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 1,000 nuevos para la compra de mesas, sillas y algunos utensilios faltantes para la inagruración de su negocio.
texts.en:
Becker is a hard-working young man of 21 years. He lives in his parent's house. Since he was young he has distinguished himself as being industrious, at first helping his parents in the fields. Years later he decided to move to the city and became a waiter in a restaurant and did other similar work. 

Now he is planning to open a business selling rotisserie chicken. At this time there are no other rotisseries around and he feels this is a good opportunity to start an independent business. He is lucky to be able to use the bottom floor of the house he lives in, which belongs to his mother. He hopes to be able to provide employment for a few local people. His long term goal is to open a similar business in the capital city of his district. He wants to become a micro-entrepreneur in order to improve his standard of living. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he hopes to use this support to get ahead. He promises to pay his installments on time. At this time he is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy tables, chairs and a few utensils he needs to open his business.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a few utensils he needs to open his business.

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es:
Rolando José de 40 años de edad, casado con tres hijos del cual el menor de 15  anos dependente totalmente de. El es originario de Nagarote lugar que está ubicado en la zona occidente del país. En sus ratos libre  le gusta disfrutar en familia con sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económicos pero se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracia a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante Rolando José tiene por actividad económica taller de soldadura desde hace ocho años ubicada en su casa de habitación y a domicilio. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su servicio actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en la compra de herramientas para  prestar servicio como soldador, pernos, varillas para soldar, cuchillas, hierro, aluminio, alicate, prensas. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Rolando José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rolando José is 40 years old, and he is married with three children, the youngest of whom is 15 and still completely dependent on him.  He is from Nagarote, which is located in the western part of the country.  In his free time he likes being with family and with his children.  Sadly he was not able to pursue schooling due to a lack of income, which forced him to work from a very young age.  For that reason he struggles every day to offer a better future to his children. 

Thanks to his efforts and his desire to get ahead, Rolando José has a welding shop that he has run for the past eight years, and it is located in his home.  He works around 10 hours per day offering his services, which he provides with great passion.  The goal of the loan is to invest in the purchase of tools in order to offer his services as a welder: He will purchase bolts, metal bars for welding, knives, iron, aluminum, pliers, and presses.

His goal is to obtain a better income in the distant future. Rolando José is thankful for the help from KIVA investors who offer help to people of limited means and to people from poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a dignified chance at work.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his welding business, including bolts, metal bars, knives, iron, aluminum, pliers, and presses.

loans.name: Agnès Prixille

texts.fr: Prixille est une femme célibataire 39 ans . elle fait dans la restauration depuis 03 ans..compte tenu de la petitesse de son capital,elle est constamment confrontée à un problème de rupturede stocks et d'insatisfaction de sa clientèle. raison pour laquelle elle sollicite un crédit pour méner à bien son activiter. les bénéfices qui en résulteront lui permettront d'étendre son activité en augmentant son stock de produits de première necessit.de même,elle compte sur cette activité pour subvenir à ses besoins vitaux et devinir autonome.
texts.en:
Prixille is a single 29-year-old woman. She has been in the restaurant business for three years. 

Given the lack capital, she is constantly confronted with a problem of gaps in her stock and dissatisfaction from her customers.

For this reason, she is asking for a loan so that she can conduct her business better. 

The earnings will allow her to expand her business by increasing her stock of staple goods. Also, she counts on this business to support her needs and to become independent.

loans.use: to increase the stock of staple goods for her restaurant

loans.name: Nazareth Shg Group

texts.en:
Nazareth SHG is constituted of ten untiring tribal women from a village; they named themselves “Nazareth SHG”. The village is about 35 kms away from the main capital town of Imphal, which is also one of the northeastern state capitals in India. 

Rahablu is the featured borrower member, pictured with her hand raised on the extreme left in the picture.  All the members cooperate and agreed to form the group to support one another financially and morally in times of one’s needs. The purpose of the formation of the group is to be financially independent and supplement the family income to be self-sufficient families.

Rahablu sells chives in the capital market and makes an income. Selling chives is her main activity to generate an income. The market town is about 35 kms away from the village where she lives. She marches towards the market at the break of the dawn, as buyers come early in the morning to get the fresh vegetables. The major population in the state uses chives in most of the dishes; thus selling chives is profitable. She shares that growing chives is easy, as the climate is suitable, there is no limited season for growing, and market demand never ceases. 

The generated income is insufficient, as household expenses and educational expenses are high in this period. She hardly managed to save a small amount to purchase seedlings and grow them abundantly. There are times when she does not have a supply of her own, and at the same time with no cash to buy chives from the suppliers and sell them at a profit.

With the KIva Loan, she is planning to purchase chives seedlings with the right fertilizers. Hopeful and filled with delight, she shares that her plans to grow chives on a large scale have come true. She will try to grow chives the whole year round with no break, and try her best to have them sell. She says she will try hard to be successful and will also repay the loan on time. She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the support and assistance. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva.”

The rest of the group members are also engaged in selling vegetables, piggery and poultry.

loans.use: to purchase more chives seedlings and fertilizers, so she can grow them and earn more profit.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase 1000 chicks and feed for their poultry project as well as mushroom spores

loans.name: Aurelle Diaz's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et se connaissent depuis plus de 10 ans.
La représentante du groupe, Aurelle Diaz (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 25 ans. Aurelle Diaz  est mariée avec Aimé qui poursuit ses études de juriste. Ensemble ils ont eu un enfant qui va à l'école.

Pour assurer les charges de la famille, Aurelle Diaz vend des pagnes qu'elle se procure au grand marché pour les revendre dans son village. En parallèle, elle développe aussi une activité de vente de mèches de cheveux. Dans le but de développer son activité, Aurelle Diaz s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three people who live in the same area and have known each other for more than ten years. The representative of the group, Aurelle Diaz (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 25 years old. Aurelle Diaz is married with Aime, who is studying law. Together they have a child, who goes to school. 

To meet her family's needs, Aurelle Diaz sells pagnes [colorful fabrics], which she procures from a large market and resells in her village. In addition, she is developing another business where she sells hair extensions. 

With the goal of developing this business, Aurelle Diaz has joined the other members of this group to ask for their first loan through Alide.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and hair extensions

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norlita works hard to support her family.

Norlita has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 24,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and to buy additional piglets for her pig fattening business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pig fattening business.

Norlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools and retail products

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, a hardworking mother of four children, all of whom are in school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees.

Amina sells women's, children's and men's clothes to passersby and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of ksh.20,000 to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: White 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Serge is one of the members of the group White 2 (2), which consists of 10 micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Serge, who is married and has two children, ages 8 and 10, is very excited to be receiving his third loan from HOPE Congo after having repaid his previous loans.

In business for more than 10 years, Serge sells locally grown fruits and vegetables. With this new loan he will be able to buy more of them to further grow his inventory. He says that one of his strategies for success is selling his produce not only to individual clients but also to neighborhood restaurants.

Serge has big dreams for the future of his business and family. He hopes to one day expand his activities to include a store that sells charcoal and gasoline. With increased profits he hopes to be able to pay for his children to attend the best university in Congo. He thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, cabbage, eggplant and  other fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Velba

texts.es:
Doña Velba es una madre soltera de 40 años de edad la cual es ama de casa y agricultora, una mujer muy trabajadora, muy luchadora y madre de 4 de los cuales 3 están en hogares a parte y un menor de 13. Ella en compañía de su conyugue se dedican al cultivo de maíz, frijol y café como también la hortaliza actividad que aprendió gracias a sus hermanos y sus padres siendo ellos agricultores por tradición familiar. El terreno que ella trabaja fue heredado por sus padres el cual esta cultiva do con café, huertas y árboles frutales levantándose diariamente por la mañana para realizar las diferentes actividades como limpieza, abono, mantenimiento, riego, etc. Ella sueña con crecer en su producción de café y obtener mejores ingresos económicos para poder ayudar y apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y en todo lo que el necesite para que pueda llegar a graduarse de la universidad y así pueda mejorar su estilo de vida y su nivel de educación.

Es por ello que diariamente lucha para poder cumplir sus sueños y sus metas y dejar a su familia un patrimonio fortalecido y un terreno donde ellos con el tiempo puedan trabajar. Para eso ella ha solicitado un financiamiento en la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 6 bolsas de nutrí café, 5 bolsas de abono 18-46-0, 6 bolsas de urea, 5 bolsas de foliar, 5 litros de alto 10 SL, 5 bolsas de abono 12-24-12 y 5 bolsas de formula cafetalera con el cual asistirá a sus cultivos y dará una mejor y mayor protección para que al final de la cosecha sea un éxito.
texts.en:
Velba is a single mother, 40 years old, and is a housewife and farmer. She is a very hardworking woman, a real fighter and mother of four, three of whom are in homes except for the one younger than 13. In the company of her her spouse, they make their living growing corn, beans and coffee and also vegetables. She learned this activity thanks to her siblings and her parents, making them farmers by family tradition. The land that she works was left to her by her parents - it is cultivated with coffee, vegetables and fruit trees.

She rises daily in the morning to carry out the different activities like cleaning, fertilizing, maintenance, irrigation, etc. She dreams about growing her coffee production and obtaining more economic income to be able to help and support her son in his studies and in everything that he needs so that he can graduate from the university. In turn, he will be able to improve his lifestyle and level of education.

It is for this that she fights daily to be able to achieve her dreams and her goals and leave her family a strengthened inheritance and a land where they, with time, will be able to work. For this she has asked for a loan in the COMIXMUL cooperative, with which she will buy 6 bags of nutrí café [fertilizer], 5 bags of "18-46-0" fertilizer, 6 bags of urea, 5 bags of foliage, 5 liters of 10 SL high, 5 bags of "12-24-12" fertilizer and 5 bags of coffee formula. These will help her plants and give a better and bigger protection so that at the end the harvest is a success.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Alfredo Jose

texts.es:
Alfredo  José casado, originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Alfredo se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar en familias. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos, y ayudar a fórmalos profesionalmente.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercaderia en general, como r  el negocio lo desempena de forma ambulante y por encargos a clientes fijos y eventuales. el objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercaderia para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  ALfredo Jose agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Alfredo José is married and from León, located in the western part of the country. Alfredo is hardworking and responsible, with a desire to improve himself. He likes to enjoy his free moments with his family. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he was not able to obtain a professional degree and found himself needing to work from an early age in order to help his family with the household expenses. Currently he fights day-to-day to bring a better future to his children and to help to train them professionally.

Thanks to his effort and his desire to get ahead, he has as his business the sale of general merchandise. He carries out his business as a street vendor by advance order from both steady and sporadic customers. The objective of his loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business in the purchase and selling of merchandise so that in the not-too-distant future he can obtain a better income. Alfredo José appreciates the help that Kiva investors offer to people with scant resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock his business through the purchase of merchandise in general such as clothing, pants, shorts, shirts, leggings, shoes, sandals, tennis shoes, bedclothes, and towels.

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara de 27 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos. Es originarias de Managua lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. su actividad consiste en la venta de cosméticos, negocio que lo inicio desde hace 5 años, el cual surgió por la necesidad de tener un herramienta de trabajo y obtener ingresos. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con su familia, aprovecha los platos típicos de la región como es Nacatamal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económico al venta de cosméticos como labiales, rubor, sombras, lápiz de ojos, cremas de cuerpos, body, desmaquilladoras, pinturas de uñas acetonas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Sara agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Sara is 27 years old, single, with no children. She is originally from Managua, a city situated in the center of the country. She sells cosmetics, a business she started five years ago, out of the necessity of having work and making money. She enjoys spending time with her family in her spare time, enjoying some of the traditional dishes of the region like Nacatamal. Unfortunately, due to the lack of money she could not study for a career. She had to work from a young age to help pay the household expenses. 

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Sara has a business selling cosmetics such as lipstick, blush, eye-shadow, eye-liner, body cream, lotion, make-up remover and acetone nail polish. She has requested this loan to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in the near future she will make more revenue. Sara is grateful for the support Kiva lenders offer people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can have a dignified livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business with cosmetics like lipstick, blush, eye-shadow, eye-liner, body cream, lotion, make-up remover and acetone nail polish.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr: Marié et père de famille, Mr Ablam est agent commercial. Pour mieux jouer son rôle de père de famille, il a décidé en 2006 de vendre des pièces détachées frigorifiques à toutes personnes dans sa boutique. Sa difficulté est le manque de fonds pour pouvoir augmenter son stock. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, il sollicite son troisième crédit de WAGES pour acheter des pièces frigorifiques. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer les besoins élémentaires des enfants.
texts.en: A husband and father, Ablam is also a sales agent. To better provide as a father, he decided in 2006 to sell spare refrigeration components to people in his shop. His obstacle is the lack of funds to increase his stock. To better meet the needs of his customers, he is requesting his third loan from WAGES to buy refrigerant gases. He wants to reinvest in the business and provide for his children's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration components for resale

loans.name: Catalina Huanca Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellas residen en el distrito del Agustino. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “CATALINA HUANCA” una de ellas es Bertha de 63 Años de edad soltera y sin hijos, Bertha se dedica hace 20 años al servicio de costura (remalle). Bertha confecciona prendas de vestir, en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y salir adelante, Bertha  a sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Bertha solicito el préstamo   para comprar confecciones de vestir (telas) ah la vez  Bertha  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Bertha esta parada y se le distingue con una casaca verde,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The group consists of 5 women, each responsible for different commercial activities. They reside in the district of Augustine. These are members of the community bank "Catalaine Huanca.”  Bertha is one member and is 63 -years –old, unmarried, and does not have children. Bertha has worked in service sewing for 20 years. Bertha makes clothing in a small space (rented) in order to progress day by day and get ahead. Bertha has managed to win over customers and to improve her quality of life. 

Bertha is requesting a loan to buy clothing dress (fabrics). Both Bertha and all members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and the confidence that they have been given. Bertha is standing and can be found wearing a green jacket. She says goodbye with the promise the she will complete all her goals.

loans.use: to make clothing

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela es una joven de 22 años de edad, la cual tiene mucha ganas de salir adelante y poder ayudar a su familia. Es por ello que con muchos esfuerzo esta estudiando la carrera de Administración y gracias a ello ha podido conseguir empleo en una institución de su ciudad como empleada de atención al cliente, con lo cual puede solventar sus gastos de estudio.

Guisela está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda podrá solventar los gastos de trámite para obtener su título universitario, de esta manera podrá obtener un mejor empleo y mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una profesional de éxito”.
texts.en:
Guisela is a 22-year-old young woman who is very driven to succeed and be able to help her family. That is why she is studying so diligently to get her degree in Administration. Thanks to this she has been able to find a job in her city as a customer service representative. With this job, she can pay for her education expenses.

Guisela is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, as it is thanks to their help that she will be able to pay the administrative expenses of getting her diploma. Then she will be able to find a better job and increase her salary, which will allow her to keep fighting toward her greatest dream: "To be a successful professional."

loans.use: to cover the expenses of getting her diploma

loans.name: Rostand Eric

texts.fr: Rostand est un homme de 29 ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants. Il possède et gère un parking pour moto dans un quartier de la ville depuis un an. il sollicite ce crédit pour effectuer l'aménagement du parking (confort et sécurité) afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et les profits. les bénéfices générés vont être injectés dans l'activité d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en: Rostand is a 29-year-old single father of two children. He has owned and operated a motorcycle parking lot in the city neighborhood for a year. He is requesting this loan to complete construction on the lot (for comfort and safety) to increase his sales and income. The income generated will be used partly to invest in his business and partly to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to complete construction of his parking lot

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is single with one child who attends school. They live in their own house that has no electricity or piped water. 

Binti operates a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food stall operators in her business. 

With 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) Binti wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Norly

texts.en:
Norly is 28 years old, is married, and has two children who are in school.

Norly is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Norly has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is a Kubo Financiero client and this his story.

Hello. My name is Alberto. I have been happily married for the last 18 years and have two beautiful daughters, Diana Guadalupe and Paola Guadalupe. Both go to school. I am a car mechanic and fortunately I have many recurring clients. I am changing my car shop from a place that I rent, to my house. By doing that, I will be able to save some money in the rent that I am paying. I will use the loan to refurbish the place. In general, my clients seek me, they tell me what is wrong with their cars, and I provide them with a budget. Once they agree, I start fixing the car. I have been a car mechanic for the last 30 years and have owned my car shop for the last 14 years.

My biggest accomplishment is owning a business and a house and sending my daughters to school. My next goal is to make my business grow. I believe I am a credit-worthy person because I always pay my debts on time.

loans.use: To condition and refurbish the repair shop in his house

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar owns a generator that he uses to provide electricity for his neighborhood to compensate for the shortage of electricity by the power company. He purchased the generator in 2008 and he has hired four employees. He grew fast in this field and gained good experience. The demand has increased due to the lack of supply and the summer heat. He took this loan to build a roof that will protect his generator and the power lines and to build a room for the guard.

Haidar is requesting a loan for 1,200 USD to build a roof and build a room for the guard. He is aiming to continue to grow in this field and buy a new generator in another place to serve more people and save them from the hot summer without national electricity in Iraq.

The story of Haidar and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of a small business where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to build a roof for the generator and build a room for the guard.

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en:
Zaid is is requesting a $1,100 youth loan in order to purchase new brand-name clothes such as dresses and jeans in different brands and trends. He notes that selling good quality clothes will help him attract more customers and increase his sales.

The story of Zaid and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who have been able to improve their business with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to increase his summer collection.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Sumpango Sacatepequez Group

texts.es: Dúo Solidario Sumpango Sacatepequez, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Odilia de 39 años de edad ella desde hace 15 años se ha dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de bordados, esta contenta porque por medio de su negocio ella ha podido darles lo mejor a sus hijos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en: The Dúo Solidario Sumpango Sacatepequez group was formed by Maria Odilia who is 39 years old. For 15 years she has been making and selling typical weavings and as a secondary activity she makes and sells embroidered items. She is happy because through her business she has been able to give her children what’s best. She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies to make and sell typical weavings.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to make and sell traditional weavings

loans.name: Luchadores En Accion Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luchadores en Acción está conformado por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios de León, lugar que está  ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de su familia y prepararles platos típicos de la región como es “indio viejos”  lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Yesica es la coordinadora del banco comunal Luchadores en Acción y tiene   por actividad económica  una pulpería, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, cuajada, detergente, jabón. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El banco comunal Luchadores en Acción agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
