The Luchadores en Acción [Fighters in Action] community bank is made up of eight members - seven women and one man. They are responsible mothers and fathers with fifteen children under their responsibility. The are from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country. They are characterized by their responsible, hardworking personalities, eager to better themselves. In their free time they like to enjoy their families and prepare them typical dishes of the region like "indio viejos." Regrettably, they could not study due to the lack of economic resources and they were obliged to work from an early age, in order to help with the costs of home.

Thanks to her efforts and eagerness to pull herself up, Yesica is the coordinator of the Luchadores en Acción community bank. For her economic activity, she has a pulpería. A pulpería is a small store that sells edible products in small quantities like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese curd, detergent, soap. She dedicates 12 daily hours to her business, offering her products. 

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital for her work and stock her business in the purchase of edible products so that in a not-so-distant future she can obtain higher revenue. The Luchadores en Acción community bank thanks the help of the Kiva investors, who offer help to people of scant resources and of poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified working environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the purchase and sale of edible products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese curd, detergent, soap.

loans.name: Vicky Tatiana

texts.es:
Vicky Tatiana de madres soltera, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajara, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de actividades con su hijo le prepara platos típicos de la región como es “Yuca con Chingaste” lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad por falta de recursos económicos y para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño hijo.

Gracia a  su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, huevos, pan, jugos, gaseosas, fósforos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa  de habitación, en el cual invierte unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Vicky Tatiana agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Vicky Tatiana, of the communal bank "Madres Solteras" (Single Mothers), is a native of Sauce.  Sauce is located in the north of the country.  Vicky Tatiana is known for being a hard-working, responsible woman who wants to improve her personal situation.  In her free time, she likes to do things with her son.  She makes him traditional foods from their region like “Yuca con Chingaste.”  Unfortunately, she couldn't study a profession at the university because she had to start working at a young age.  Her family was low-income and she needed to help with the household expenses.  As such, she works hard every day to offer a better future to her young son. 

Thanks to her hard work and desire to get ahead, Vicky Tatiana was able to start a business.  She has a small grocery where she sells food stuffs in small quantities.  She sells things likes rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, juice, carbonated beverages and matches.  The business is located in her home.  She invests about twelve hours a day selling her products.  The loan is to be used to invest in working capital and purchase items stock up her store with food stuffs for re-sale so that in the not so distant future she can earn a better income.  Vicky Tatiana is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to low-income people and poor countries, like Nicaragua, so they can earn an honest living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital for her small grocery by purchasing and selling of food stuffs like rice, beans, sugar, bread, milk, detergent, soap, juice, carbonated beverages, cookies, cheese, and curds.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Doña Andrea es originaria de la ciudad de Esteli, soltera y madre de una hija. Se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortilla desde hace mucho tiempo, negocio el cual ha sido de mucha ayuda para su familia logrando mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar. Solicita el credito para comprar maiz al por mayor, con el fin de elaborar mayor produccion a sus clientes. Tiene como espectativa hacer crecer su negocio, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Andrea is originally from the city of Esteli. She is a single mother with a daughter. She has worked in the creation and sale of tortillas for a long time. The business has been a lot of help to her family. She has been able to improve the infrastructure of her home. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale corn with the loan to create more production for her clients. She has an expectation to grow her business, have more income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal es un hombre muy trabajador, que lucha por salir adelante y quiere dar todo lo que necesita a su familia. Es un hombre que ha luchado mucho y que quiere seguir haciéndolo por su familia. Cuenta que su crédito anterior lo utilizó para la compra de materias primas.
Hoy solicita de nuevo un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de rollos de maderas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir luchando para ayudar a su familia. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Vidal is a very hardworking man who strives to get ahead and who wants to provide everything necessary for his family.  He’s a man who has struggled much and who wants to continue to do so for his family.  He relates that he used his previous loan to buy raw materials.

He’s asking for a new loan today to buy rolls of lumber to continue striving for his family.  He’s grateful for this new opportunity he’s getting.

loans.use: to buy rolls of lumber to sell.

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio tiene 34 años, es soltero y vive en su casa construida a base de madera. Demetrio se dedica a la agricultura propiamente orientada a la producción de cacao orgánico y otros productos rentables de su zona. Se inicio en está actividad hace más de 15 años con ayuda de sus padres ya que siempre fue un hijo muy trabajador. Inicialmente recibió un terreno que le cedieron sus padres y empezó a brindarles los cuidados necesarios de acuerdo a los conocimientos adquiridos para lograr campañas de buena producción. Uno de sus principales inconvenientes al iniciarse de manera independiente fue que no contaba con dinero suficiente para cubrir algunos gastos que requiere esta labor, tales como la compra de abono orgánico y el pago de a los trabajadores del lugar, el cual es necesario para terminar sus tareas pendientes en un menor tiempo. Actualmente posee 2 hectáreas de terreno donde sigue expandiendo sus plantaciones de cacao en beneficio de su económica para lograr con el tiempo realizar alguno de sus objetivos que es la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono organico y así nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Demetrio is 34 years old, single, and lives in a home constructed of wood. Demetrio works in agriculture particularly oriented towards the production of organic cocoa and other profitable crops in his area.

He started this activity more than 15 years ago with help from his parents as he was always a hardworking child. He was initially ceded land from his parents and he began to provide the needed care according to the knowledge he had acquired in order to achieve a good harvest.

One of main drawbacks of starting independently was that he did not have enough money to cover some expenses required in this work, such as buying organic fertilizer and payment to the laborers which is necessary in order to finish the pending chores in less time. 

Currently he has 2 hectares of land where he continue expanding his cocoa plantations for the benefit of his finances in order to achieve over time some of his goals such as constructing a home of better material.

This is his first Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support that he receives so he can get ahead, and he agrees to make his payments punctually. At this time he is asking for 2,000 soles in order to buy organic fertilizer so he can nourish his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Nory

texts.en:
Nory is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year, and she earns additional income by selling bananas and growing coconuts.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of rice seed and fertilizer, to use in her rice farming business.

Nory has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice seed and fertilizer to use at her farm

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Please meet 39-year-old Rachel, from Buchanan.  Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating 'fufu,' a cassava based dough that is typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

Rachel finished 12th grade.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman. She is married, and her spouse works as a businessman.  They have three children, aged between 5 and 15, who are in school and live at home.

Rachel runs a salon.  She has been in this business for seven years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours per day.  She started her business with money from her husband.  She transports her goods by taxi.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is low income.

With this loan, she will buy additional artificial hair, shampoo, conditioner, and other beauty products.  She is proud of her business, because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house.  She thanks you, in advance, for your support!

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products to use at her salon, like artificial hair, shampoo, and conditioner

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 47 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos pues durante su vida dedicó su tiempo a sus padres y a su familia, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hermanas y su cuñada. El trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la venta de productos comestibles, cada 2 días se dirige al mercado mayorista de la ciudad en donde hace las compras necesarias para volver a surtir su negocio con los productos que se terminaron que puede ser arroz, leche, azúcar, huevos, embutidos y otros. Trabaja siempre con una frase implantada en su mente: “trata bien al cliente, ten todo lo que busca y volverá siempre” es por eso que ella no se descuida y siempre está abastecida con todo lo necesario para vender. Su negocio esta en su casa en donde tiene la ayuda de su madre que siempre esta a su lado, lleva realizando esta labor desde hace 4 años. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche, condimentos y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old, single, and has no children. She has dedicated her entire life to her parents and her family. Rosa lives in her own home with her sisters and a sister-in-law. Her work consists of selling food products. Every two days, she goes to the wholesale market in the city in order to buy necessities and then returns to restock her business with products that are lacking. These items include rice, milk, sugar, eggs, cured meats, and other products. Rosa always works with a phrase that is stuck in her mind: “Treat the customer well and everything you have always been looking for will come back to you.” For this reason, she has never neglected her business and always keeps it stocked with everything she needs to sell. Rosa’s business is located in her home and her mother is always by her side to help. She has been in this business for four years.

Rosa is taking this opportunity to request 1,000 PEN and is very pleased to know that she will receive financial support so that she can advance her business. In addition, she promises to submit her payments in a punctual manner. The amount she requested will be used to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, condiments, and sodas.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk, condiments, and sodas.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 36 años de edad, está casada con Máximo de 36 años con quien  tiene 2 hijos de 10 años y 8 meses de nacido respectivamente. Vive junto a su familia en su casa propia hecha de adobe.Es conocida como una mujer muy trabajadora que optó por dedicarse a las actividades agrícolas produciendo alguno de los productos más rentables de su localidad como el cacao orgánico gracias a las terrenos que recibió por parte de sus padres en calidad de herencia. Lleva 15 años a cargo de dichos terrenos y con el apoyo de su esposo Máximo con quien se dedica integralmente al mantenimiento periódico de los árboles cacaoteros han logrado obtener muy buenos resultados. Le agrada desempeñarse en el campo puesto que es una labor abnegada fuera de problemas y complicaciones dependiendo mucho del esfuerzo que uno le dedique, ya que el obtener buenas mazorcas termina siendo beneficioso en cuanto al precio final que los compradores le otorgan. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevo soles para la compra de abono orgánico y así fertilizar sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old and married to Máximo, aged 36, with whom she has two children aged 10 years old and 8 months old. She lives together with her family in their own house made of adobe. She is known to be a very hard-working woman who opted for working with agricultural activities. She produces some of the most profitable products of her locality, such as organic cocoa, on the land she inherited from her parents. 

She has been in charge of these pieces of land for 15 years and with the help of her husband Máximo, who is also taking care of the cocoa trees, she has been able to obtain very good results. She likes working in agriculture because it is a selfless labor free from problems and complications, which depends much on the effort one devotes to it. Obtaining good corncobs will have a positive impact on the final price she receives from her buyers. 

This is her second loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support she is receiving in order to improve her situation, and pledges to make her repayments on time. On this occasion she is asking for 2000 PEN so that she can buy organic fertilizer and fertilize her cocoa cultivations.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Deisy Noemy

texts.es: Doña Deisy de 30 años de edad, vive en casa de una familiar, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos que estudian actualmente. Ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años es una persona responsable, atenta y amable con sus cliente, lo que la ha llevado a obtener gran clientela  que demanda sus productos, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de su gastos familiares, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de mercadería como granos básicos, azúcar, sal,  sopas, jabón, detergentes, golosinas,  etc. Para mejorar su tienda y así obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Deisy is 30 years old. She lives in a relative’s home with her husband and two children who are currently studying.

She has a store where for several years she has been a responsible person, caring and friendly to her customers which has led to a large customer base who wants her products. Thanks to her work she has managed to pay some of the household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as basic grains, sugar, salt, soup, soap, detergents, candy, etc. in order to improve her store and thus obtain better profits and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, salt, soup, soap, detergents, candy, etc.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is 28 years old, single, and has one child. She lives in the town of Dansoman-Accra. 

Gifty has a business, selling mobile phone credit (vouchers) from several networks, including Vodaphone, MTN, Airtel, and Tigo. Her business is located in front of her house and has been in operation for four years. Gifty is requesting a loan of GHS 1500. The loan will enable her to buy more vouchers, in several different denominations, so she can satisfy all her customers. Her goal is to grow her business. On a personal level, she wants to take care of her son and give him the level of education of his choice.

loans.use: To buy enough vouchers, in different denominations, to be able to satisfy all her customers.

loans.name: Edwin Javier

texts.es:
Latacunga es una ciudad que cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos para turistas nacionales y extranjeros principalmente por el Centro Histórico de la ciudad que ha sido considerado Patrimonio Cultural del Ecuador desde hace casi 30 años. Capital de una de las provincias que forma parte de la Región Sierra del Ecuador; Cotopaxi y que los últimos años se ha desarrollado notablemente de tal forma que es considerada una de las más importantes de la región gracias a la industria florícola, minera, metalúrgica, agroindustria, agrícola y ganadera. Además existen establecimientos de negocios que generan interesantes ingresos lo que le convierte en una ciudad comercial y con varias oportunidades para salir adelante a pesar de que las estadísticas indican un índice de pobreza que supera el 50%. Sin embargo el gobierno seccional y la empresa privada han aportado para que sea una ciudad en constante crecimiento, es así que recientemente se ha construido un aeropuerto y centros comerciales que han generado fuentes de empleo para muchos de sus habitantes quienes también conservan un espíritu emprendedor como es el caso de Edwin un joven esposo y padre de 24 años, estudió la secundaria y siendo muy joven se casó con Yolanda de su misma edad que se dedica al cuidado de su hogar. Tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando en una escuela pública y a quienes esperan verlos convertidos en profesionales de excelencia. 
Edwin desde hace 5 años se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, negocio que decidió emprender por la falta de oportunidades laborales en su ciudad. Él disfruta mucho de su trabajo, por lo que ninguna tarea es complicada a pesar de que invierte mínimo 8 horas desde muy temprano en la mañana, hasta la tarde que es en donde las ventas se reducen y además los productos se agotan. Cada temporada del año Edwin debe abastecerse de los productos que sus proveedores traen y que son demandados en el mercado. La falta de capital y las dificultades para obtener financiamiento han sido obstáculos que Edwin ha tenido que vivir en cada etapa de su negocio, sin embargo ha buscado siempre la manera de tener las frutas y verduras más demandadas. Ahora la temporada cambia y el surtido de su negocio empieza a decaer, por lo cual solicita un préstamo para comprar frutas y verduras de temporada con las cuales pueda atraer más clientes y así ganar reconocimiento en la ciudad, además que esto le generará mayores utilidades con lo cual puede brindar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, incluida la educación de excelencia que espera que sus hijos reciban. 
Edwin da gracias a Fundación Alternativa por la oportunidad que le brindan de buscar crecimiento en su negocio, pues está muy contento con la atención recibida y con la asesoría personalizada que su ejecutivo de cuenta le brinda en cada visita.
texts.en:
Latacunga is a city that has many attractions for domestic and foreign tourists, mainly the historic center of the city that has been considered Cultural Heritage of Ecuador for nearly 30 years.  It is the Capitol of a province that is part of the Sierra region of Ecuador, Cotopaxi and in recent years has developed significantly in a way that is considered one of the most important in the region thanks to the flower industry, mining, metallurgy, agribusiness, agriculture and livestock. In addition, there are businesses that generate interesting income, which makes it a commercial town with several opportunities to get ahead even though statistics indicate a poverty rate exceeding 50%. Despite this, the government and private enterprises have contributed to the city so that it is constantly growing. Recently the town built an airport and shopping centers that have generated employment opportunities for many residents who also maintain an entrepreneurial spirit such as the case for Edwin. 

Edwin is young husband and father of 24. He studied in high school and though very young married Yolanda who is the same age and works to take care of their home. They have 2 children who are studying in a public school and they hope to see them become excellent professionals.

Edwin has been a vendor of fruits and vegetables for 5 years when he decided to undertake business due to lack of employment opportunities in his city. He really enjoys his job, so that no task is complicated even though invests at least eight hours a day from early morning until evening. This is where sales decrease and the products are exhausted. Each season of the year Edwin stocks products from his suppliers that are demanded in the market. The lack of capital and financing difficulties has been obstacles that Edwin has had to surpass at every stage of his business. However, he has always sought ways to have more of the fruits and vegetables that are highly demanded.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Los Amigos Empresarios Group

texts.es: El grupo “LOS AMIGOS EMPRESARIOS” está conformada por  08 socios dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio minorista. Quienes se encuentran muy contentos por estar  pasando al 03 ciclo. Clara tiene 41 años es casada con 03 hijos educando. Hace 3 años apertura una librería en su vivienda en el cual le va bien de esta manera ha podido apoyar a su esposo con la educación de sus 3 hijos. Clara años atrás tuvo un  negocio de bar con el cual forma un capital para cambiar de giro a librería. Calara  en sus tiempo libres se dedica a la costura. El grupo cumple la función de presidenta quien fue elegida por los socios. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cuadernos lapiceros y libros. El grupo  agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Clara es la primera persona parada del lado izquierdo viste casaca beige.
texts.en:
The group "Los Amigos Empresarios" is comprised of 8 members that work in various retail businesses and they are proud to be in their third loan cycle. 

Clara is 41 years old and she is married with 3 school-age children. Three years ago she opened a book store in her home and it went very well, as she was able to support her husband in paying the education fees for their 3 children.  

Years ago, Clara owned and operated a bar, and with the money from that business she was able to close the bar and open a book store.  In her free time, Clara likes to sew.  Clara is the president of this group and was elected by the other members.  

This loan will be used to buy notebooks, pens, and books.  The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the loan they are providing. In the photo, Clara is standing on the left and she is wearing a beige jacket.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, and books

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mburucuja está en su ciclo número ciclo numero 13 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están trabajando muy a gusto juntas, se ayudan las unas a las otras y se fijaron como meta poder crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona, ya que saben que eso es muy importante también.
Una persona digna de mencionar es una de las integrantes, la señora Susana, quien tiene una estupenda sazón, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, sugiere que le va muy bien, ya que tiene buena ventas, pues a sus clientes le gusta mucho lo que ella prepara. Hoy Susana pide de este crédito ya que quiere invertirlo en comprar insumos para seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, y demás, ya que quiere seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que prepara. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called “Mburucuja” is in its 13th loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program.  They enjoy working together and helping one another.  They have established a goal for growth, not only financially, but also as people since they know that aspect is very important.  

Someone who is worthy of mention is Sra. Susana, one of the members.  She sells food that has great flavor.  Susana generates good sales, which suggests that she is doing very well.  Her customers greatly enjoy what she prepares.  Today she is requesting a loan in order to invest in the purchase of supplies so that she can continue preparing her dishes.  These items include vegetables, meat, condiments, and other products.  Susana wants to continue delighting her customers with the delicacies that she prepares.  She is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia es socia del grupo de crédito 14 de Agosto, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación, verdes campos y de una tranquilad sin igual, su gente es amable y gentil quienes se dedican en especial a la dura tarea que aprendieron de sus padres la cual es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes actividades, aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Silvia tiene 54 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y la ayudan económicamente. Su esposo se dedica al negocio de la madera ya que es aserrador, la casa en la que  vive es propia.

La Señora. Silvia se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y ganado del cual vende la leche, también siembra y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar pero si existe un sobrante lo vende. 

Este es el cuarto crédito que realiza en su grupo y va a ser invertido en la compra de una vaca lechera. 

Su meta es tener más animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
Silvia is a member member of the loan group "14th of August," and lives in the area of the parish of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a lush area blessed with green fields and unparalleled tranquility. The people there are friendly and courteous, and they live their lives dedicated to the hard work they learned from their parents, raising animals and agriculture. Many also live in the city doing many kinds of work, but they still maintain the culture and traditions of the villages.

Silvia is 54 years old. She and her partner have five children. Three of whom are married and live on their own, and they have two single daughters who work and help out economically. Her husband is in the wood industry and runs a saw. They live in their own home.

Silvia raises guinea pigs, chickens, and dairy cows. She also keeps a garden for the household, selling any extra produce.

This is her fourth loan through the group, and it will be invested in the purchase of a dairy cow. Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio, tiene 38 años de edad padre de tres hijos de las edades de cuatro meses hasta nueve añitos, dos de ellos estudian la escuela primaria, Juan los mantiene a todos al igual que a su esposa quien es ama de casa. El se dedica a su pequeña pulpería con la que se apoya para la manutención de su familia. El  crédito que solicita es para invertir en el negocio con granos básicos, pollo, carne para garantizar las ventas del día, siendo este el único ingreso fijo del hogar, el cual puso con ahorros de su anterior trabajo como guarda de seguridad y con la ayuda de su madre, por lo que su mayor deseo es salir adelante.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is 38 years old and the father of three children who are between the ages of four months and nine years. Two of his children are in primary school. Juan Antonio supports them all as well as his wife, who is a homemaker. He has a small store that allows him to support his family.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in his business by purchasing basic grains, chicken, and meat. This will guarantee that he can make his daily sales since this is his only steady source of household income. Juan Antonio opened his business with savings from his previous job as a security guard and with help from his mother. His greatest wish is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, cereals, and sodas.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. Her previous loan was of great help to her life, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of fruits and green vegetables, for resale

loans.name: Bethleem (1) Group

texts.en:
Marie is one of the members of the group, Bethleem (1). The group is comprised of five micro-entrepreneurs from Brazzaville, Congo. Marie is married and has five children, whose ages range from 3 months to 12 years. Marie is very excited to be receiving her fifth loan from HOPE Congo, after having successfully paid off her previous loans. She has had her business for around ten years. Her business consists of selling second-hand shoes, sandals, handbags, large sacks, and other, miscellaneous pieces of clothing.

With this next loan, Marie will be able to buy more sandals and bags, to further grow her inventory. By buying in bulk, she will be able to reduce the prices she pays, giving her a competitive advantage in her bustling market.

Marie has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that, one day, she will be able to buy a plot of land of her own, for her family and children. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy more second-hand sandals and bags to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, es estudiante de la carrera enfermería, vive con mis padres quienes por el momento están solventando mis gastos y ella también ayuda cuando puede, pues Su meta es culminar sus estudios, poder trabajar bien y así poder ayudar a sus padres y comunidad, y retribuir todo lo que recibió.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad y de esa forma seguir estudiando y estar cada vez más cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
Maria is from the town of Paraguarí. She is nursing student and lives with her parents who are currently paying her expenses. Maria helps when she can. Her goal is to finish her studies and get a good job so she can help her parents and the community. She wants to give back all that she has received.

Maria is seeking a loan to pay for her university courses so she can carry on with her studies and get closer to her goal.

loans.use: Pay her university course fees

loans.name: Fabio

texts.es:
El Señor Fabio tiene 36 años, está acompañado con la señora Celia, son de la Ciudad de Villarrica, el se dedica a la fabricación casera de ladrillos y su cocción, también tiene cultivo de caña de azúcar y ganados.
El es padre de 3 hijos, por quienes él se esfuerza para poder darles todo lo que necesitan y que el día de mañana sean personas de bien. Esta actividad la heredo de su padre, ya que todos en esa zona se dedican a ese rubro.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla y leñas para poder seguir haciendo sus ladrillos y venderlos de esa forma a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fabio, 36, is in a relationship with Celia. They are from the city of Villarrica. He makes a living by making and firing homemade bricks. He also has sugarcane crops and livestock.

He is a father to three children. He works hard to give them everything they need so that they can be good people in the future. He inherited his business activity from his father, because everyone in the region works in this field.

He has applied for a loan to invest in the purchase of clay and firewood to continue making bricks to sell to his clients.

loans.use: to buy clay and firewood to make bricks.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 14 de agosto está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y están con muchas ansias de poder capacitarse y seguir creciendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Blanca quien tiene una despensa y en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que con el tiempo ha ido mejorando y creciendo y sueña con que el día de mañana su pequeña despensa vaya creciendo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, fideos, arroz y demás insumos para poder seguir surtiendo a su clientela y darles todo lo que buscan. Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe por parte de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The group called "14 de agosto" [14th of August] is in its 6th cycle of the committee programme, where they are doing the poverty elimination survey. They are very hard-working women and are very keen to have training and carry on improving. 

One of the members is Blanca who has a small grocery store where she works every day from the early hours of the morning. She is a very hard-working person who has continued to improve and make progress over time and she hopes her small grocery store will continue growing in the future. 

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, meat, noodles, rice and other supplies so she can continue supplying her customers and giving them everything they are looking for. She is grateful for the opportunity she is being given by Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, noodles, rice and other supplies.

loans.name: Koeti Group

texts.es:
El grupo Koeti está en su ciclo número 18º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades propuestas por el grupo, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo.
Maria es parte del grupo, y ella vende cosméticos, le está yendo muy bien en su emprendimiento, pero sabe que por medio de su esfuerzo  y sacrificio es la única forma de salir adelante. Es una persona luchadora que quiere mejorar su vida.
Solicita de este crédito ya que quiere tener mas variedad de cosméticos que poder ofrecer a sus clientas. Agradece por esta ayuda que esta recibiendo que le será muy útil.
texts.en:
The Koeti group is in its 18th cycle of the women's committee programme, where they all work and help each other to improve their lives. They all participate actively in the activities proposed by the group and they support each other to achieve the common objectives they have within the group. 

Maria, who is a member of the group, sells cosmetics and her business is going well. However, she knows that hard work and self-sacrifice are the only way of making progress in life. She is determined person who wants to improve her life.

Maria is asking for the loan because she wants to have a larger variety of cosmetics to offer her customers. She is grateful for this help she is getting which will be very useful.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rocela works hard to support her family. She has a butcher shop in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional pork, beef and chicken, to sell at her butcher shop.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her butcher shop business. Rocela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pork, beef and chicken, to sell at her butcher shop

loans.name: Miguel Octavio

texts.es: El cliente reside en el sector de Suburbio en Guayaquil.  Hace 13 años comenzó con un puesto pequeño de venta de colas.  Al momento ya posee un negocio más establecido y grande con respecto al de antes.  Trabaja con su hija todos los días, de 6 am a 11 pm.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de fritada.  Tiene hijos que ya son mayores de edad.  Ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para la compra de medicina para un tratamiento médico.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the Suburbio sector of Guayaquil. He started his business 13 years ago with a small stand selling colas. At the moment, he has a large and well-established business compared to before. He and his daughter work every day from 6:00 A.M. to 11:00 P.M. The borrower is married and his wife sells fried foods. His children are already grown.

For now, the borrower needs the money from his loan so that he can buy medicine for his treatment.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a fish selling business. She sells from home, to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bundles of fish and establish a greengrocery store. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and establish a greengrocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, rice, sugar, beans, firewood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos, a sus 18 años de edad, es un joven activo, enérgico y emprendedor. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, decidió conseguir ingresos por cuenta propia, con el fin de aportar a la economía de su hogar y ayudar a sus padres, por lo que desea iniciar una barbería, en sociedad con un amigo (Ver foto en la que aparece titular y socio). Es por esta razón que se motiva a solicitar el apoyo de su primer crédito, pues desea comprar 2 sillas de barbería, 2 tocadores completos, 1 lavacabezas, máquinas de motilar e insumos (gel, crema de afeitar, shampoo) con el fin de dar inicio a su idea de negocio. Carlos manifiesta que posee la ventaja de no tener competencia cercana, por lo que puede darse a conocer y poco a poco ir aumentando su clientela, lo que se verá reflejado en la cantidad de ingresos que obtendrá, además desea generar un empleo adicional, es decir, trabajarán 2 personas prestando el servicio de barbería y 1 que se encargará de administrar el negocio y vender la mercancía que desea incluir en su portafolio (camisas, jeans, gorras, correas, todo esto para uso masculino). Es así como Carlos desea cumplir el sueño de generar sus propios ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia con la carga económica, lo que le permitirá a mediano plazo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is 18 years of age and an active, energetic, and enterprising young man.  After finishing high school, he decided to continue earning income on his own so that he could support his household financially and help his parents.  For this reason, Carlos decided to open a barber shop with one of his friends (seen in the photo is his business partner).  This is why he is requesting the support of his first loan.  He will buy two barber chairs, two vanities, one washing station, clippers, and supplies (gel, shaving cream, and shampoo) so that he can launch his business idea.  Carlos says that he has an advantage since there is no competition nearby, so people will get to know him and he can gradually increase his clientele.  This will ultimately be reflected in the amount of income he can generate.  Carlos also wants to create one additional job.  In other words, there will be two people providing barber services and another person in charge of managing the business and selling additional merchandise that he wants to include in his inventory (men’s shirts, jeans, caps, and belts).  Carlos wants to fulfill his dream of earning his own income and helping his family with the financial responsibilities.  As a result, he and his family can improve their quality of life in the midterm.

loans.use: to buy two barber chairs, two vanities, one washing station, clippers, and supplies (gel, shaving cream, and shampoo).

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Marina con 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo. Desde muy joven se interesó por la confección, por lo que decidió aprender realizando diversos cursos, que más adelante le abrieron las puertas en el campo laboral. Trabajó en diversas empresas de confección, donde adquirió experiencia y perfeccionó su técnica. Su último empleo fue en una empresa grande y reconocida de ropa para bebés y niños, donde laboró varios años, para luego independizarse.  Con la liquidación compró 3 máquinas,  consiguió diversos contratos con terceros y además realizaba arreglos de modistería. Es así como ha obtenido los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hijo y para solventar los gastos de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recayó sobre ella, porque el padre de su hijo nunca le colaboró económicamente. Marina es una mujer pujante, emprendedora, con gran esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su hijo, quien es el motor de su vida y el que la motiva a seguir avanzando, sobrepasando los obstáculos que se le presentan. Esto la ha llevado a solicitar el segundo ciclo de crédito, que será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, elásticos, botones) con lo que podrá sacar una producción de uniformes que tiene pendiente, y además poder ofrecer variedad de telas y colores a sus clientes, esto dará como resultado el aumento en sus ventas y por ende, en sus ingresos. 
Marina sueña con seguir avanzando y en un futuro cercano tener un taller de elaboración de muñecos, cojines, lencería y artesanías, además desea seguir generando ingresos para poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida al lado de su hijo.
texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old, single, and has one son. She has been interested in making clothing since she was very young, and for this reason she decided to learn the trade by taking various courses. These courses later opened doors for her in the work world. She has worked in various clothing companies, where she gained experience and perfected her technique. Her last job was in a large, well-known children's and babies' clothing company in which she worked for a number of years in order to later start her own business. With the liquidation of the company, she bought three machines and managed to obtain various contracts with third parties. In addition, she does clothing alterations and repairs. Through this work she has been able to earn enough income to support her son and pay for her household expenses. She says that all of the economic responsibility has fallen on her, because the father of her son has never helped her economically.

Marina is strong and entrepreneurial, and with a lot of effort she has provided for her son, who is her driving force in life and who motivates her to continue moving forward and to overcome the obstacles that fall in her way. This loan is Marina’s second loan cycle with the field partner, and she is requesting it to buy fabric, thread, elastic and buttons at wholesale prices. She will use these items to make uniforms for a pending order, as well as to offer her customers a variety of fabrics and colors. She hopes this will result in an increase in her sales and income.

Marina’s dream is to continue getting ahead, and in the near future, to have her own workshop for making dolls, cushions, lingerie and handicrafts. She also hopes to continue earning income so that she and her son can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and buttons at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo Group

texts.es: Elvia es integrante del grupo “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” conformada por 12 mujeres emprendedoras. Siendo Elvia la que preside al grupo, hace muchos años que cuenta con una bodega en su vivienda poco a poco ha llegado a implementar su negocio. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo  apoyado en la educación de sus hijos, de la cual se siente feliz. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de  golosinas y bebidas. Seguir creciendo su negocio es su mayor deseo. Elvia tiene 50 años casada con 01 hijo independiente. El grupo “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso. Elvia  se encuentra la parte posterior es la  cuarta del lado izquierdo,  viste chompa celeste y chaleco negro.
texts.en: Elvia is a member of the “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” group, made up of 12 enterprising women. Elvia leads the group. She has had a small store for several years in her house. Little by little, she has outfitted her business. With the results of her labor she has supported her children's education, and that makes her happy. Her latest loan will be used to buy snacks and beverages. Continuing to make her business grow is her biggest wish. Elvia is 50 years old, married, and has one child who is on his own. The “Jesucristo Es Mi Modelo” group is grateful for the loan, since it has made its progress possible. Elvia is in the back, fourth from the left. She is wearing a light blue sweater and a black vest.

loans.use: to buy snacks and drinks

loans.name: Unidos Para El Exito Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5  personas emprendedoras y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “unidos para el éxito”. La Sra. Carmen  de 46 años de edad soltera y madre de 2 hijos, ella se dedica hace 2 años  a la venta de comida tanto en el día como en la noche  La Sra. Carmen, ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su comida y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en  ampliar su local para poder tener mas clientes y  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Carmen  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Unidos para el Exito Communal Bank is made up of five enterprising members with a lot of creativity for business.

Carmen, 46, is single and the mother of two children.  For two years she has sold food during the day and at night.  Carmen has managed to build customer loyalty, which has generated profits to be able to cover the household expenses.  In the future she would like to have her own place to be able to sell her food and earn more profits.

She'll invest the loan in expanding her work space to be able to have more customers and to get ahead.

Carmen and all the members are grateful to Kiva and EDAPROSPO for the loan granted and for the trust placed in them.  She signs off with a promise to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to expand her work space

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 41 years, and she earns additional income by raising pigs and farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her businesses.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma works hard to support her family. She is married and earns a living by selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines. Elma has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She has been in business for four years and would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is married with two children who are both in school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She operates a computer shop in which she provides printing, photocopying and typing services for her customers, who are mostly passersby and neighbors. She is requesting for a loan for KSH. 20,000 to buy paper and color toner for her business. She joined Yehu to secure access to financial support.

loans.use: to buy paper and color toner for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 50 años es una mujer admirable. Vive en compañía de su esposo Jesús, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo vive con el último de ellos; en su casa propia. Hace un año, falleció su hija producto de una enfermedad, para poder curarla tuvo que vender sus cuyes, se siente triste al recordarlo. Ahora tiene solo 38 ejemplares, pero está trabajando para aumentar su crianza. Pero no solo cría cuyes también vacas, toros y gallinas de buena calidad, de ahí obtiene ganancias por la venta de leche y de los animales. Además su esposo trabaja en el gobierno de su ciudad, donde la pagan un sueldo mensual. Ya los fines de semana los dos se dedican a la siembra de maíz y alfalfa en sus terrenos agrícolas propios, la alfalfa le ayuda en el alimento de su ganado, pero el maíz lo comercializa en su mismo terreno agrícola, ya que es de muy buena calidad y ya tienen compradores fijos. Ahora desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Este es su tercer crédito con kiva, por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que el apoyo financiero que recibe le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos. María; invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de más cuyes para aumentar su ganado, además de crear más corrales para que vivan.
texts.en:
María, 50, is an admirable woman.  She lives with her husband, Jesús, with whom she has three children but only the youngest one of them still lives with them in her own house.  A year ago her daughter died due to illness and in order to cure her she had to sell her guinea pigs; she feels sad recalling this.  Now, she only has 38 left but is working to increase their number.  But she doesn’t just raise guinea pigs; she also raises cows, bulls and good quality chickens.  Form them she earns profits selling milk and the animals.  In addition, her husband works for the city government earning a monthly salary.  They both spend weekends working growing corn and alfalfa on their own land.  The alfalfa helps them to feed their cattle, but she sells the corn in her own fields because it’s good quality and she has regular customers.

Now, she’d like to make some improvements to her house’s infrastructure.  This is her 3rd loan with Kiva so she promises to be punctual with her payments because the financial support she gets helps her improve her income.  María will use the 1,000 soles to buy more guinea pigs to increase her livestock and also to build more corrals for them to live in.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs at wholesale.

loans.name: Dinora Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña dinora de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia  junto a sus tres hijos que estudian actualmente,  ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas, etc. y joyería desde hace varios años es una persona muy amable y servicial con sus clientes posee mucha demanda por sus productos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa y también vende de forma ambulante en una zona muy tranquila y accesible además muy transitada que le facilita vender todo su producto, de esta manera a logrado solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, dinora solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor porque tiene mucha demanda y a si mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora is 39 years old and lives in her own home with her three children who are students. She has sold  perfume, deodorant, lotions, creams and jewelry etc. for the past few years. She is a very friendly person and helpful to her clients and she has many requests for her products. She works from her home and also works door to door in an accessible, quiet but well-traveled area which helps her sell her goods. She manages to pay her household expenses. 

Dinora is asking for this loan to buy more product, wholesale, as she has lots of requests. And in this way she can increase her revenues and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfume, deodorant, lotions, creams and jewelry etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijas, una es menor de edad, y está cursando la secundaria, y la otra es universitaria, y ella está cursando la carrera de Administración de empresas.
Norma; tiene una peluquería propia que había montado con  mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Gracias al trabajo y sacrificio que está realizando, Norma educa a sus hijas, y les compra todas las necesidades del hogar y de esa forma no les falta nada. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
Ella ya tuvo otros créditos con fundación paraguaya, y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones. 
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de tintes, shampoo, enjuagues y demás insumos y de esa forma seguir con la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma’s a single mother; she has two daughters.  One of them is a minor attending secondary school and the other one attends university majoring in Business Administration.  Norma owns a small beauty salon that she set up with much effort and sacrifice.

Thanks to the work and sacrifice she’s been doing, Norma educates her daughters and buys them everything needed at home so that they lack nothing.  She’s shown herself to be a very responsible, honest person with her commitments.

She’s had previous Fundación Paraguaya loans and met her obligations excellently.  She’s requesting this loan to buy hair color, shampoo, rinse and other supplies to continue providing service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de las Mercedes se formo en la ciudad de Luque, son mujeres muy emprendedoras, que están unidas para poder crecer y salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza donde 3 mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos y luchando por mejorarlos.
Integra este grupo la Sra. Catalina, quien vende verduras, y con los ingresos que tiene de su trabajo ayuda a su familia para darles una vida digna, y sin privaciones. Ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras de todo tipo, ya que quiere poder dar a sus clientes una buena variedad. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que ella y su grupo esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called Virgin of Mercies was formed in the city of Luque. They are very enterprising women who have united in order to grow and forge ahead. They are committed to making the attempt to eliminate poverty. Three of the women have very low incomes and are struggling to improve themselves.

A member of this group is Catalina who sells vegetables. With the income she earns from her work she helps her family, striving to provide them with a dignified life without deprivations. She is a person who is very anxious to grow and get ahead.

Catalina is requesting her loan to invest in purchasing vegetables of all types. She wants to offer her customers a good variety. Catalina is grateful for the opportunity that she and her group is receiving.

loans.use: buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Stephenetta

texts.en: Stephenetta is 32 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populous and well-known market towns in the Liberian county of Montserrado.  She attends a university while managing a business to make ends meet. She sells used clothing for three days in a week, 10 hours per day.  She and her fiancee live together with their two children, who are 3 and 8. Her older child attends school. Stephenetta has been in her current line of work for three years and, while things are sometimes slow, most of the time she earns a profit which she uses to help sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more used clothes to sell. Her goal for the future is to build a decent house. She appreciates support from BRAC Liberia and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Aira

texts.en:
Aira is 32 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

Aira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to resell.

Aira has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from food vending, raising pigs and selling vegetables.

Aira aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 46-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water access.

Ruth has operated a kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish joint every day for 22 years. She operates in front of the market where passersby and town dwellers are her customers. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to purchase enough so that she can sell to customers better. 

With the loan amount of GHS 1,200, she wants to buy two bags of maize and a carton of fish so that she can serve customers better. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy two bags of maize and a carton of fish so that she can serve her customers better.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is married, the mother of four children and a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and three of her children attend school. She earns a living by buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Vilma has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell. She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are electricity and rent. For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, where she sells various food items to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in competition from other retail shops, and dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy bundles of sugar, salt, beans, rice and soap to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that she could use to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, beans, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 31 años, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que viven junto a ella en su casa construida a base de adobe. Inicialmente se dedicaba a la agricultura inducida por sus padres quienes se dedican a esta actividad laboral. Tras cumplir 18 años se casó y tuvo a su primer hijo, viéndose obligada a quedar en casa cuidando a su pequeño,decidió poner un negocio en el primer piso de su vivienda dedicado a la venta de productos comestibles al por menor tales como leche, azúcar, arroz y demás productos con buena demanda. Lleva muchos años realizando esta labor y ha visto por conveniente cambiar de rubro de su negocio y junto a su hermano poner un restaurante. Uno de sus principales objetivos es tener varios negocios dedicados a la venta de comida en su localidad y en la capital de su distrito espera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para arreglar el local en donde estará ubicado su restaurante.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 31 years old, married and has two children who live with her in her adobe house. She used to work in agriculture because her parents worked in this trade and taught her how to do it. When she was 18, she got married and had her first child, and because she had to stay at home to look after him, she decided to start selling food products from home such as milk, sugar, rice and other products in high demand.  She has been working in this área for many years has now decided that it would benefit her to change the focus of her business and start up a restaurant with her brother. One of her main objectives is to have many food-selling businesses in her area and in the capital of her district. She hopes that this will generate more income for her and a better quality of life. This is her first Kiva loan and she fells grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to be able to get ahead, She also pledges to make timely payments. On this occasion, she is asking for 2000 nuevos soles to renovate the premises in which she plans to start her restaurant.

loans.use: to give maintenance to her new premises.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 28 years old and married with two children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Alma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Etta

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Etta from Liberia, who has been selling charcoal for the past three years now, has asked for a 30,000 LRD loan to build up her business by buying more charcoal to resell. To be precise, Etta lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She did not attend school, but she said she is good at managing her business. 

Etta is single with seven children between 18 and 29 years old. Only one is currently attending school, and three live at home. 

Etta complains that the transportation cost is her main challenge.  She enjoys the flow of her customers and the profit she makes. She sells for eight hours each day. 

She hopes to build a house in the near future. She appreciates the support of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to build up her business by buying more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
A Sra. Luisa de 34 anos de idade é casada e tem 4 filhos dos quais 2 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e os outros 2 são ainda muito pequenos para frequentar a escola. Ela é negociante hé mais de 7 anos, vende diversos produtos da 1ª necessidade no seu estabelecimento comercial.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos como feijão, amendoim, caldo, refresco, farinha de milho, batata, peixe, tomate, arroz e outros para aumentar o volume do seu negocio no seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Luisa is 34 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom attend elementary school and two of them are still too young to attend school. She has been a trader for over seven years and sells products that are household staples in her store.
The current loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as beans, peanuts, broths, refreshments, cornflour, potatoes, fish, tomatoes, rice, etc., so that she can increase turnover in her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as beans, peanuts, broths, refreshments, cornflour, potatoes, fish, tomatoes, rice, etc., so that she can increase turnover in her store.

loans.name: Activo De Vitarte Group

texts.es: La Sra. Celinda  de 53  años de edad soltera  y madre de  3 hijos, la Sra. celinda  tiene un  pequeño bazar ya hace unos  3  años. La Sra. Celinda,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos (mochilas, colonias, porta retratos etc.) Para su bazar  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. celinda y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Celinda es la primera de la mano derecha  se le distingue por su casaca de color purpura, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Celina is 53 years old and is a single mother of 3 children. She has been running a market stall for the last three years. Celinda has won loyal customers, and has generated profits that she uses to cover household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own premises from which she can sell her merchandise and increase her profits. She plans to spend the loan on buying more products (backpacks, colognes, picture frames etc.) for her market stall and to continue satisfying the needs of her customers so that she can get ahead. Celinda and all the members of the group are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the trust that the lenders have invested in them. Celinda is the first on the right of the photo, wearing a purple jacket. She promises that she she will fulfill all of the goals she has set for herself.

loans.use: to buy products for her market stall.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Anita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell in her buy-and-sell charcoal business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Artimiza

texts.pt:
Artimiza tem 39 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 5 filhos que estudam.
É comerciante e com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento e ferro, para dar início à construção de sua casa pois agora vive numa feita de material precário.
Sonha terminar a obra, mobilar e comprar uma viatura para usar como transporte de sua mercadoria e para alugar.
Diz que irá pagar pontualmente de modo a solicitar outros créditos e assim realizar seu plano para o futuro.
texts.en:
Artimiza is 39 years old and single. She has five children who study.
She's a merchant. With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement and iron so she can start building her house, because right now she lives in a house made of substandard materials.
She dreams of finishing the house, furnishing it and acquiring a vehicle for carrying her merchandise and for renting out.
She states that she'll repay the loan in a timely fashion so she can apply for other loans and therefore achieve her plans for the future.

loans.use: to purchase cement and iron so she can start building her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete the purchase of a video game rental store and also to buy movies, baked goods and candy to sell there.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is single with one child who is in school. They live in a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water.

Beatrice sells clothes, and she has been in the business for three months. Her major challenge is seasonality. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ludovina

texts.pt:
Ludovina e solteira mae de um filho, negociante há mais de 10 anos, tem 59 anos de idade e trabalha 8 horas diárias, como negociante na sua residência.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de cobertores, cadeiras, mesa, bacias e alguns produtos alimentares como ovos para revenda.
Futuramente diz que pretende construir um estabelecimento comercial próximo da sua casa. O principal desafio da Ludovina e de manter o seu negocio e pagar o empréstimo sem atrasos para solicitar mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Ludovina is single and has a son. She has been a trader for over 10 years. She's 59 years old and works 8 hours a day from home as a trader.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase blankets, chairs, a table, bowls and some foodstuffs such as eggs for re-selling.
She states that in the future she intends to build a store near her home. Ludovina's greatest challenge is keeping her business afloat and repaying the loan without delays so that she can request more loans.

loans.use: to purchase blankets, chairs, a table and bowls for re-selling.

loans.name: Salva Uamongo

texts.pt:
Sra. Salva de 54 anos de idade,solteira e tem 3 filhos dos quais 2 sao indepedentes, 1 esta a frequentar escola no ensino secundario. Ela e Operaria Agricola numa empresa de producao de banana a mais de 5 ano.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construcao ( chapas de zinco, barrotes, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade a construcao da sua casa.
texts.en:
Salva is 54 years old and single. She has three children, two of whom are independent and one who is attending high school. She has been a farm worker for a banana company for over five years.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, beams and rocks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, beams and rocks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Petrona Ivania

texts.es: Doña Petrona es originaria de Managua, tiene 53 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Es comerciante y se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y zapatos. Gracias a su esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación ha podido mantener su negocio estable, lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficio para mejorar su calidad de vida. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso  la ayuda monetaria que le brinda su esposo. Su expectativa es seguir creciendo en su negocio  y establecer una tienda. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: ropa y zapatos escolares, ya que tiene encargos de este tipo de productos, lo cual es rentable. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Petrona, 53, is from Managua.  She's married and the mother of three children.

Petrona's a merchant who sells cosmetics, clothing, and shoes.  Thanks to her effort, work, and dedication she has managed to keep her business stable, which has helped her a lot to improve her quality of life.  Another source of income is the financial help her husband gives her.  Her expectation is to continue growing in her business and to set up a store.

She's requesting the loan to buy clothing and school shoes because she has orders for these products, which are profitable.  She thinks the loan will be a big help because she'll be able to invest in her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing and school shoes

loans.name: Vladimir Enrique

texts.es:
Vladimir un hombre muy trabajador de 30 años de edad. Termino el bachillerato en 2003 y desde ese año se dedica a cortar cabello. Actualmente, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos gemelos de 5 años de edad, que estudian kinder en la escuela del cantón. 
Es propietario de una peluquería, desde hace 9 años. Está a 4 kilómetros del cantón y viaja todos los días desde su casa para brindar ese servicio de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. El oficio lo aprendió cuando recibió, un curso impartido por la alcaldía, entregándole un diploma por dicho esfuerzo.
Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando, para pagar una deuda pendiente en otra institución financiera.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos que se puedan valer por si mismos, mejorar mas el negocio y contratar empleados. Desea enseñarles a sus hijos, su oficio para que en un futuro administren el negocio.
texts.en:
Vladimir is a hardworking man who is 30 years old. He has been cutting hair since he finished high school in 2003. He is married and has 5 year old twins who attend kindergarten in the canton. 

He has been the owner of a barber shop for 9 years. It is 4 kilometers from the canton and he commutes every day from his home to offer service from 8:00AM until 5:00PM. He learned the trade when he took course given by the city, earning a diploma for his effort.

The loan will be helping him to pay a pending debt from another financial institution. 

His dream is to see that his children are self-sufficient, to improve the business and to hire employees. He wants to teach his children his job so that in the future they can manage the business.

loans.use: to pay a pending debt at another financial institution

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt: De 38 anos de idade, solteira e negociante no mercado da sua zona,  vende produtos da primeira necessidade quase todo o dia. Zaida vive com 2 sobrinhos que estudam.O dinheiro do emprestimo sera aplicado na compra de produtos como amendoim, cebolas, batata-reno e outros produtos comestiveis para revenda.Um dos principais desafios da Zaida é de fazer crescer o seu negocio e disse que ira pedir mais emprestimo para ampliar a sua casa e comprar mais bens de consumo.
texts.en: Zaida is 38 years old and single. She's a merchant at her local market. She sells products that are household staples nearly all day long. Zaida lives with two nephews who study. The money from the loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as peanuts, onions, potatoes and other foodstuffs for re-selling. One of Zaida's biggest challenges is making her business grow. She states that she'll request more loans so that she can enlarge her house and buy consumer goods.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as peanuts, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Flora

texts.pt:
Flora tem 38 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 2 filhos, 1 dos quais ainda estuda. O seu marido trabalha na África do Sul.
Flora vive na casa própria e à base de negócio que faz em sua casa e como ambulante. Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: farinha, óleo, açúcar, carnes, mantas, loiça plástica, etc., para ampliar o seu negócio.
A sua esperança é ver seu negócio crescer, melhorar suas condições de vida e garantir melhores condições para os seus filhos.
texts.en:
Flora is 38 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom still studies. Her husband works in South Africa.
Flora lives in a house that she owns. She makes a living by doing business from home as well as door-to-door. With the current loan she intends to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, meat, blankets, plastic tableware, etc., so that she can expand her business.
She hopes to see her business grow, improve her living conditions and ensure better conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, sugar, meat, blankets, plastic tableware, etc., so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Her greatest  monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rose operates a food stall business, selling household consumables from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the 70,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gerardo De Jesus

texts.es: Don Gerardo vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus 3 hijos.
