El se dedica al cultivo de maíz, desde hace varios años , es  una persona humilde, responsable, honesta y dedicado a sus labores ,  es muy conocido por su buen carácter y por sus excelentes cosechas, adicional a su siembra posee una tienda donde tiene mucha demanda , gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado solventar algunas de sus necesidades  y las de su familia, don Gerardo solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos para el cultivo de maíz como: semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herramientas, etc. Para poder aumentar sus cosechas y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gerardo lives in his own home with his life companion and 3 children. He has been growing corn for several years. He is a humble, responsible, and honest man who is dedicated to his work. He is well known for his good nature and for his excellent crops. 

In additional to farming he has a high demand store. Thanks to his work and effort he has managed to pay for some of his own needs and those of his family.

Gerardo is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies for growing corn: seeds, fertilizers, compost, tools, etc., in order to be able to increase his harvest and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, compost, tools, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and beans

loans.name: Michael M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are members of a primary school in Bo city. They want a loan of 17,600,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) to help them meet their immediate needs. Some of them want the loan in order to invest in business, some to pay their childrens' school fees and other school-related charges, and others would like to invest the loan in a house-building project.

Michael is the featured leader of this group. A native of Gboyama, in southern Sierra Leone, the 53-year-old is married to a teacher, and the couple has three children who are attending schools. Michael has been a schoolteacher for 25 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets, cement, etc., for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.name: Agartha D.

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Agartha D., who lives in the town of West Point. She is married and has three children, ages 10, 13 and 16. Her children are attending school and living at home. She is a high school graduate who is now selling sugar and flour by the cup to make her life and her children's lives better. She considers herself a hardworking businesswoman. She sells from Monday to Saturday, spending 7 hours on her business since she has to go home early to prepare food for her family at home.

Agartha D. has requested a loan to purchase more flour and sugar in bags so that she can increase her daily sales. She hopes to be an international businesswoman one day, and she hopes to have her own house. She is happy being a BRAC Liberia borrower.

loans.use: to purchase more flour and sugar in bags so that she can increase her daily sales.

loans.name: Bernanda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Bernarda  tiene 55 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad  de Managua, madre de seis hijos. Es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de comida, bebidas y postres helados. Empezó  su negocio a la edad de 30 años. Solicita este crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne, gaseosas, bolsas entre otros con el fin de abastecer a sus clientes logrando satisfacer sus necesidades. En este negocio la apoya su esposo e hijos. . Estima que este crédito será de mucho beneficio ya que podrá obtener ganancia  a través de la inversión. Sus expectativas es expandir su negocio. Su plan futuro es construir un cafetín donde comercialice más sus productos ya que realiza las ventas en casa.
texts.en: Bernarda is a 55-year-old mother of six from the city of Managua. She is a retailer and sells food, drinks and frozen desserts. She started her business when she was 30. She is requesting this loan to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat, sodas, and bags among other things to meet customer demand. Her husband and children help her to run her business. She believes that this loan will be really helpful to her as she will be able to create more profits through the investment. She hopes to expand to business. Her future plan is to build a cafetería where she will sell more products as right now she sells from home.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat, sodas, and bags, etc.

loans.name: Maria Santiaga

texts.es:
María, es una persona muy emprendedora que trabaja mucho, vive con su compañero de vida  y sus cuatro hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 9, 14, 18 y 19, todos dependen de ella y no posee familiares en el extranjero. La Sra. María se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, asimismo crianza de aves de corral, dicha actividad lo aprendió hace 2 años por su necesidad económica  y lo desempeña desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm, ventaja con el negocio de tortillas es que lo vende diariamente y un puesto accesible para los clientes.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar materia prima tales como: maíz, leña y concentrado para las aves de corral. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos económicos y mejorar las condiciones de vida; los riesgos de las tortillas es que si no se venden pronto, se dañan rápido  y en cuanto a los animales es una posible plaga. 
Su sueño es seguir trabajando para generar mayores ingresos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is a very enterprising person who works a lot. She lives with her life partner and their four children, aged 9, 14, 18 and 19. They all depend on her. They have no family members living abroad. Maria makes and sells tortillas and also raises chickens, which she learned how to do two years ago, out of economic necessity. She starts to work at 6am and continues until 3pm. She has the advantage of selling the tortillas every day from a stand that is convenient for her customers.
María is asking for this loan to buy raw materials like corn, wood and concentrated chicken feed. This investment will help her to increase her income and improve their living standard. The problem with the tortillas is that if they do not sell quickly they can go bad and for the animals it is potential epidemics. Her dream is to continue working in order to create more income and offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood and concentrated feed for poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Albano

texts.pt:
O Sr. Albano de 43 anos de idade, casado e tem 6 filhos que estão a frequentar escola no ensino primário e secundário. Ele e segurança numa escola do ensino secundário.
O presente empréstimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construção (barrotes, janelas, portas, chapas e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
texts.en:
Albano is 43 years old and married. He has six children who attend primary and high school. He's a security guard for a high school.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (beams, windows, doors and metal sheets) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (beams, windows, doors and metal sheets) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Joao Baptista

texts.pt:
O Sr. Joao de 55 anos de idade, é casado e tem 5 filhos dos quais 2 são independentes, 2 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário e outro vive com o seu tio. Ele e Operario Agricola numa empresa de produção de banana.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para compra de material de construção (blocos, cimento, janelas, chapas, pagamento de transporte e mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Joao is 55 years old and married. He has five children, two of whom are independent, two attend primary and high school and one lives with his uncle. He's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, windows and metal sheets) and to pay for labor and transportation so he can continue building his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, windows and metal sheets) and to pay for labor and transportation so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Romao

texts.pt:
Romão tem 25 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é pai de 2 filhos ainda sem idade escola. Tem a 10ª classe e vive numa casa de aluguer.
Romão é mecânico há longos anos e tem um estabelecimento onde faz a prestação de serviços de mecânico numa das ruas da vila de Moamba. Com o empréstimo pretende comprar cimento, areia, chapas de zinco, ferro, etc, para melhorar as condições do seu estabelecimento.
Ele tem o sonho de ter uma oficina grande, uma ferragem mecânica de venda de peças, ter uma viatura e construir uma casa para arrendar.
O seu maior desafio é a falta de dinheiro para concretizar seus projectos.
texts.en:
Romão is 25 years old. He's married and has two children who haven't reached school age yet. He completed 10th grade and lives in a rented house.
Romão has been a mechanic for several years and owns a shop where he provides auto repair services in one of the streets of the village of Moamba. With the current loan he intends to purchase cement, sand, metal sheets, iron, etc., so he can improve the condition of his shop.
He dreams of owning a large shop, owning a store that sells hardware and auto parts, owning a vehicle, and building a house for renting out.
His biggest challenge is the lack of money for accomplishing his projects.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, metal sheets, iron, etc., so he can improve the condition of his shop.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERALDA”  iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisol es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de juguetes, pensión, venta de ropa, confección de polleras, costura de ropa, confección de mandiles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisol es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; este negocio lo aprendió porque trabajaba como operaria en un taller, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de costura.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The credit group "Esmeralda" is starting its 10th loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de los Andes. The group is made up of eight women and is led by an executive board, of which Marisol is the president. The businesses run by the women in the group are varied: tailoring coats, selling toys, an inn, selling clothes, making skirts, making clothes, and making aprons. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit the entrepreneurs who are members of the group along with Marisol. Marisol says that she has been with Pro Mujer for eight years. She became involved at the invitation of her mother, who is a partner with the institution. Now, she has her own sewing workshop. She learned this business by working in another workshop, and she later decided to open her own shop. 

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital to purchase fabrics from the best shops. She will then create products and sell them in her commercial space. This work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, because she lives with her family and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes she likes the health and credit training.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Constancio

texts.pt:
O Sr. Constancio de 36 anos de idade, casado e tem 2 filhos dos quais 1 esta a  frequentar a escola no ensino secundário e a outro não tem idade para frequentar a escola. Ele è Auxiliar de saúde há mas de 5 anos.
o presente empréstimo será aplicado para compra de material de construção (chapas de zinco, ferro, cimento, blocos e mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade a sua casa.
Tem  como desafio futuramente melhorar as condições de habitação e a dieta alimentar, ter mais fundo na Hluvuku-Adsema para a construção do muro da sua casa.
texts.en:
Constancio is 36 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom attends high school and the other one hasn't reached school age. He has been a healthcare assistant for over five years.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, iron, cement and bricks) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.
His challenge is to someday improve his living conditions and his diet, and to get more funds from Hluvuku-Adsema so he can build a wall around his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (metal sheets, iron, cement and bricks) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Joisse

texts.pt:
Joisse de 42 anos de idade, é viúva e possui 2 filhos que estudam no 1º ano da universidade e o outro anda na sétima classe.
O dinheiro do empréstimo será aplicado na compra de produtos como arroz, refrescos, leite e outros produtos alimentares para revenda.
Joisse espera conseguir manter o seu negocio. O seu principal desafio é tomar conta dos seus filhos, isto é, poupar dinheiro para pagamento de propinas da faculdade ate à sua conclusão.
texts.en:
Joisse is 42 years old and a widow. She has two children, one of whom is in the first year of college and the other one is still in 7th grade.
The money from the loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as rice, refreshments, milk and other foodstuffs for re-selling.
Joisse hopes to be able to keep her business afloat. Her main challenge is taking care of her children, that is to say, saving money to pay for college fees all the way to graduation.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, refreshments, milk and other foodstuffs for re-selling.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a food stall where she sells milk, avocados, sweet bananas and mangoes. Margaret has been in this business for 10 years and sells on a retail basis only. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality.

Margaret has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of avocado, bunches of sweet bananas, bread and milk. She aspires to grow fruits like mangoes and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include market dues and school fees.

loans.use: To  buy more avocados, sweet bananas, bread and milk to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan’s mobile food truck business travels around El Paso serving Mexican food favorites.  This business supports Ivan, his wife and one child.  For more than two successful years, Ivan’s profits grew enough to enable him to expand his menu, create employment and fund renovations to his food truck.

Ivan and his family came up with the name of the business - Q’Vo Tacos - and he used personal savings to get things started.  As he became successful, he made the decision to include catering.  But he needed additional capital to go to the next level.   A family member told him about Accion Texas Inc.   So he applied for a microloan and was approved.

He has used his loan to purchase quality ingredients for his menu items, repair and further improve his food truck, and pay for his one employee.

loans.use: to purchase quality ingredients for his menu items, repair and further improve his food truck, and pay for his one employee.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 30-year-old married woman from Jabalia. She is the mother of three young children: a boy and two girls. Yasmin's husband is a worker with a very low wage. He works long hours to cover all the family needs. 

Yasmin and her husband would like to improve the home living conditions but they dont have enough money. Yasmin took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy simple seats for the living room. By applying this loan Yasmin and her husband will be able to improve the house conditions. 

Yasmin appears in the photo in her home.

loans.use: to buy simple seats for the living room.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 20-year-old single young man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a very simple home. His father is a worker with a low wage, which barely covers all the family needs. Karam is a student in his second year. He is a very clever man. He is specialized as a Medical Secretary.

Karam took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for his study. This will help him to do his homework and reports easily.

Karam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Jorge Rafael

texts.es: Jorge de 50 años de edad, habita en le municipio de Barranquilla, ciudad de gente alegre y donde los carnavales forman parte de sus fiestas autóctonas. Allí tiene un taller de ebanistería, oficio aprendido de sus abuelos y padres, que lo trasladaron de generación en generación. Su experiencia en la madera data de hace 23 años, cuando observando a sus progenitores conoció e inició la aplicación de técnicas de carpintería y las puso al servicio de los ciudadanos de su sector.  Hoy produce juegos de alcobas, salas, comedores, puertas y ventanas, que vende de contado y a crédito todos los días en un horario productivo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Sus compras las realiza en almacenes mayoristas, donde encuentra descuentos por copras de contado y en volumen. Su meta es aumentar su producción, e incrementar sus ventas, porque necesita ampliar su negocio y contratar un operario, todo ello con el fin de ganar más para remodelar más adelante su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un primer credikiva, mediante el cual comprará madera, triplex, pinturas, disolventes, clavos y accesorios, con lo que planea incrementar su producción y generar mayores ventas, pues sus clientes esperan por los pedidos solicitados a Jorge quien forma una familia con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 20 a 29 años de edad.
texts.en:
Jorge is 50 years old. He lives in Barranquilla, a city of happy people where carnivals make up a part of the traditional festivities. There he has a carpentry workshop, a trade he learned from his grandparents and parents, that has been passed on from generation to generation. His experience in woodwork dates back some 23 years when he watched his elder relatives and learned and began applying the techniques of carpentry and offering his services to the citizens of his sector.

Today he produces bedroom, living room and dining room furniture, doors and windows. He sells by cash and credit every day on a productive schedule from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. He makes his purchases at wholesale stores where he finds discounts for cash and in bulk.

His goal is to increase production, and increase sales, because he needs to expand his business and hire a helper. All this will help him to earn more so he can remodel his home at a later date.

He is asking for his first Kiva loan so he can buy wood, plywood, paints, solvents, nails and accessories as he plans to increase his production and generate more sales as his customers are waiting for orders already placed from Jorge who has a family consisting of a wife and 3 children ranging from 20-29 years old.

loans.use: to buy wood, plywood, paints, solvents, nails, and accessories

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Two years ago, Virginia went to work as a janitor, working for someone else.  As time passed, the owner decided to hand the business over to Virginia.  She accepted and changed its name to Vicky’s Cleaning.

As the current owner, Virginia saw an opportunity to employ her family when she receives larger contracts at commercial or residential sites too large to handle alone.  In the future, she plans to employ more workers whenever she can.

Before Virginia could accept contracts in larger offices and homes, she needed to purchase more equipment including a vacuum and cleaning supplies. Virginia says she was fortunate that the previous business owner left her with a couple of items to complete jobs, but to tackle larger projects, she needed to update and expand her equipment.

A visit to the Brownsville Chamber of Commerce placed Virginia on the path to Accion Texas Inc., a nonprofit microlender with America’s largest microloan portfolio.  She applied and was approved. Without the loan, Virginia says she would not be able to grow her newly-obtained business.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 33 años de edad, está casada con el padre de sus 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia . El trabajo de Juana consiste en la venta de sábanas. Ofrece al público diversas prendas y accesorios de cama en diversos diseños, colores y modelos. Su clientela básicamente son sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, además de algunos nuevos clientes que siempre llegan ocasionalmente a su puesto de ventas por recomendación. Algunas veces le solicitan pedidos con anticipación, los cuales reparte en el transcurso del día. Lleva ya trabajando en este rubro 5 años, trabaja sola ya que su pareja busca por su lado otros ingresos económicos para su hogar.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para realizar otras actividades, además tiene independencia y dispone de su tiempo para dirigirse a zonas o lugares donde cree que realizará alguna venta y conseguira nuevos clientes, por ahora espera consolidar su negocio ya que le está yendo bien. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 700, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará sábanas al por mayor en diversos modelos y colores.
texts.en:
Juana is 33 years old and married to the father of her two children. She lives in her own home. Juana’s work consists of selling bed sheets. She offers the public different types of bedding and bedroom accessories in various designs, colors, and styles. Her clientele basically consists of friends, relatives, and neighbors. She also receives a few new customers who come occasionally to her retail shop based on a recommendation. Sometimes she accepts orders in advance and then delivers them throughout the course of the day. Juana has been working in this trade for five years. She works alone since her partner is looking for other ways to earn household income.

What she enjoys about her work is having the time to pursue other activities. In addition to being independent, Juana has available time to travel to different areas and places where she can conduct a few sales and acquire new customers. For now, she hopes to consolidate her business since it is doing very well.

Juana is taking this opportunity to request 700 PEN. She is grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue her work and achieve better results. Once again, Juana promises to submit her payments in a punctual manner. The amount she requested will be used to buy bed sheets in bulk in a variety of styles and colors.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets in bulk.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 24-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother for four young boys. Alaa's husband is a construction worker with a low wage. His job is seasonal and not stable. Alaa and her husband would like to improve the home conditions since it became very old. 

Alaa took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the costs of repairing the home, especially the paint. This will offer the family better living conditions in their home. 

Alaa appears in the photo in FATEN branch.

loans.use: to pay the costs of repairing the home, especially the paint.

loans.name: Doris J.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is a group of teachers from the southern city of Bo. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 10,900,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Doris is the featured leader of this group. She was born in Segbwema 46 years ago. She is married to an NGO worker, and together they have three children, who are attending school. Doris has been a school teacher for 20 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets and cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated sheets and cement for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Majed

texts.en: Majed is a 21-year-old single young man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a very simple home. His father is a worker with a low wage that barely covers all the family's needs. Majed is a student in his last year. He would like to complete his BA study and take a master's degree. He is specializing in Business Administration. Majed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his homework and reports easily and to read the news and articles on the internet. Majed appears in the photo while he was purchasing his laptop

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
With more than five years of experience as a truck driver, Jose finally decided to go into business for himself in May 2013. With his own truck, Jose’s business allows him to obtain lease contracts, hauling whatever is needed according to the business he’s working with across the 48 states.

Working with freight brokers, Jose stays busy finding projects to complete, but with the extent of his driving, he needs extra funds to maintain his truck. Jose ventured for a loan at his bank, which then referred him to microlender Accion Texas Inc. 

Once he applied and was approved for a business loan, Jose was able to drive worry-free doing what he loves for a living.

loans.use: to pay for truck maintainance.

loans.name: Sumini

texts.en:
Sumini is married with 8 children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother).  She has a retail shop and has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more crates of soda, rice, maize flour, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. She has been in this business for 2 years. She works in the 
shop seven days a week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality, and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to help with transportation.  She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, rice, maize flour, bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil .

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecelia is 37 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Ma. Cecelia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods like can goods, milk, soap, chips, etc.

Ma. Cecelia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling banana.

Ma. Cecelia aspires to save enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods like can goods, milk, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is married with two school going children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees.
She operates a posho mill(grinding machine) and grinds cereals such as maize, millet and her customers are passersby. She faces the challenge of the machine breaking down and needing a lot for repair.
She is requesting a loan of ksh. 50,000 to purchase sacks of maize for her grinding business. She joined Yehu for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize for her grinding business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 52 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, canned goods, etc. to sell. Grace has been in this business for 30 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, rice, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama is 42 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number-one commercial county in Liberia. Mama is married and has two children, aged 16 and 22. Only one lives at home and attends school. Mama stopped her education at eighth grade, and she describes herself as very hard working. For the past 10 years she has been operating a table where she sells rice, oil, pepper, etc. She started this business with money given to her by her fiance. She enjoys her business because it gives her more money. She sells six days a week, from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m., and most of the time she uses a bus to get her goods to her table. She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventories such as rice, oil and pepper for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more inventories such as rice, oil, pepper etc for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle. Helen has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested a new loan to further build her transportation and farming businesses. Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Charline requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Charline is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Jenita works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Jenita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like eggs, noodles, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. She successfully paid back her most recent loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. Jenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like eggs, noodles, milk, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos de 19, 17, 15 y 13 años. Ella estudio solamente tercer grado. Su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, sus hijos viven actualmente con ella,el mayor ya no estudia, sus otras tres hijas siguen estudiando. La señora María comenta que  se dedica al negocio desde que tenia 13 años, su familia era pobre por eso dejo de  estudiar, el negocio con el que inicio es la venta de tortillas, pero después comenzó a vender pasteles,gaseosas,turrones y papas fritas. Para salir bien con todo se levanta a las 5 de la mañana a preparar el desayuno a sus hijos. luego comienza  los quehaceres del hogar y prepara la venta de la tarde.

Lleva  3  Años  de vender platos típicos, dice que lo aprendió sola.  La necesidad de ayudar a su pareja la llevo a continuar después de acompañarse, sus hijos le ayudan después que llegan de estudiar. La jornada comienza a la 1:PM termina a las 6:PM     

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 30 polines” C “ y 160 metros de lamina para mejorar el techo de su vivienda. Su objetivo es, instalar  una tienda, y que sus hijas se gradúen en la universidad, ademas, terminar de construir la casa.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of four children (ages 19, 17, 15, and 13). She only completed school through the third grade. Her partner is a farmer and her children currently live with her. María’s oldest child is not in school, but her three other daughters are continuing their studies. She says that she has been in business for 13 years. Since her family was poor, Sra. María had to quit her studies. The business she started involved selling tortillas, but afterwards she began selling pastries, sodas, nougat candy, and potato chips. In order to be successful at everything, María must wake up at 5:00 A.M. so that she can prepare breakfast for her children. She then begins her household chores and preparing the goods that she will sell in the afternoon.

María has been selling traditional dishes for three years and says that she learned this all by herself. The need to help her partner continued after they began their relationship. Her children help her after they return from school. The work in her business begins at 1:00 P.M. and concludes at 6:00 P.M.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy 30 “C” boards and 160 meters of roofing sheets so that she can repair the roof of her home. Her goals are to open a store and see her daughters graduate from the university. In addition, she would like to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy materials for repairing the roof of her house.

loans.name: Maritel

texts.en: Maritel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Maritel has been in this business for 1 year now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Maylene

texts.en: Maylene is 39 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soap, sugar, coffee, etc. She has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. Maylene aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, soap, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Lorena Piedad

texts.es: La cliente vive en Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás con una tienda, se dedicaba a la venta de cuadros y tarjetas también.  Ahora ya se ha estabilizado y con esfuerzo ha logrado montar un ciber, con el cual ha progresado hasta el día de hoy.  Trabaja con sus hijos, todo el día.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja como taxista de lunes a domingo.  Tiene un hijo menor de edad que va a la escuela fiscal de su zona.  Desea que en un futuro su ciber crezca mucho más.  Por ahora necesita el dinero del crédito para la compra de medicina.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Libertad. Some time ago, she opened a store where she sold pictures and cards. Now that her business is stable, she has invested effort into setting up a cybercafé which has continued to make progress up to this point. She works every day with her children. The borrower is married and her husband works as a taxi driver Monday through Sunday. Her young son attends a state school in the area. In the future, she wants her cybercafé to grow even more.

For now, the borrower needs the money from this loan so that she can buy medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Edwin T.'s Group

texts.en:
Introducing to you, in the photo above, teachers of a primary school, situated in Bo, a city in southern Sierra Leone. Like their colleague teachers in other regions of the country, they have requested a loan of 15,100,000 Sierra Leonean leones from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  With this loan, the group members will be able to meet their immediate financial challenges, and at the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Edwin is the featured leader of this group. Edwin was born in Freetown. He is married to a teacher, and the couple has four children, two of whom are attending college. Edwin has been a school teacher for 22 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his children

loans.name: Isam

texts.en:
Isam is a 20-year-old single young man from Jabalia. He lives with his family in a very simple home. His father is a worker with a low wage, which barely covers all the family needs. Isam is a student in his second year. He is a very clever man. He is specialized in engineering. 

Isam took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for his study. This will help him to do his homework and reports easily. 

Isam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the costs of purchasing a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Floricita

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Floricita works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling coconuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Floricita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconuts to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is 57 years old and married with six children. Erna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items like canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, sugar, etc. to sell.

Erna has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Erna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of items like canned goods, milk, eggs, spices, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Melca

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Melca works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling feed and charcoal in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed and charcoal to sell. Melca has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Deria

texts.en: Deria is 46 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Deria has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs. She has been in the business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Nelsie Grace

texts.en: Nelsie Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell. Nelsie Grace has been in this business for 20 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Editha Fernin

texts.en: Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Editha has been in this business for 5 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, canned goods, oil, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, canned goods, oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Genelyn has been in this business for 7 years now.

Genelyn has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishnets for her business.

In the future, Genelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishnets for her business.

loans.name: Elen

texts.en: Elen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc. for her business. Elen has been in this business for 10 years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like nail polish, nippers, nail cutters, etc. for her business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married with 4 children, one of whom is in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Cristina is 46 years old.

Cristina has a candy-making business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 15 years.  She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business.  In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients to make candy.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Helen is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Helen has been raising pigs for 5 years, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married.  All 3 of her children are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Elena has an egg retailing business in the Philippines.  She requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 42 years old and married with 3 children, all of whom attend school.  Denia has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years.  She requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamin for her pigs.  She has borrowed from NWTF 22 times in the past to sustain her business.

In the future, Denia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with eight children, three of whom attend school.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Nilda is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Nilda has been raising pigs for three years.  She also earns additional income from selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 56 years old and married with three children.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Marina has a frozen foods retail business in the Philippines.  She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en:
Pisa is a 53-year-old married woman with 8 children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and cabbages to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 3 years.  Pisa has requested a loan to buy a bush knife, axe, file, chainsaw, chemicals, and fertilizer.

She has been a member of SBPD since 2009.  With her profits, Pisa hopes to save for her children's school fees and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a bush knife, axe, file, chainsaw, chemicals, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Meritiana

texts.en: Meritiana is a 20-year-old married woman with 1 child.  She would like to start growing taro, banana, yam, and tomatoes in order to earn a living.  Meritiana has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and wheelbarrow for her business.  She will spend her profits to support her family and to pay for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chainsaw, and wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Tagiilima

texts.en:
Tagiilima is 25 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business catching and selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, spears, and a diving mask for her business. 

In the future, Tagiilima hopes to buy a modern boat for her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a new canoe, spears, and a diving mask.

loans.name: Mulauvao

texts.en:
Mulauvao is a 19-year-old young lady with no children.

Mulauvao would like to start growing taro, taamu (giant taro), yam, and bananas to earn a living. She has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and taro root.

Mulauvao will spend her profits to help support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, and taro root.

loans.name: Manufou

texts.en:
Manufou is a 56-year-old married woman with five children.
 
She would like to start growing taro and bananas in order to earn a living. Manufou  has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, gloves, fertilizer and taro root. 

She joined Kiva partner SPBD in 2013 in order to gain access to financial services.  Manufou will spend her profits to support her family. 
"

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer ,bushknives, gloves, fertilizer and taro root.

loans.name: Katalina

texts.en:
Katalina is 46-years-old and married with two children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for  two years.  Katalina needs a loan in order to buy a backpack sprayer, a chain saw, bushknives, a file, a rake and a wheelbarrow for her plantation.

She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2009. Katalina will use the profits from her sales to help her family meet their daily needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a chain saw, bushknives, a file, a rake and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Peau

texts.en:
Peau is 62-years-old and married with four children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years.  Peau needs a loan in order to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, a taro root, a bushknives, a file and a pickaxe for her plantation.

She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2008.  Peau will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, taro root, bushknives, a file and pickaxe.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children.  She would like to start growing taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living.  She has requested a loan to buy a bush knife, spade, chainsaw, file, and pickaxe.  Janet will spend her profits to improve her family’s standard of living.  She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain excess to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a bush knife, spade, chainsaw, file, and pickaxe.

loans.name: Meripa

texts.en:
Meripa is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. 

She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Meripa has requested a loan in order to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, bushknives, fertilizer, a rake, a pick, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe,a shovel and vegetable seeds.

She has been a member of Kiva partner SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Meripa hopes to save more money for her children's education.
"

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer ,bushknives, fertilizer, a rake, a pick, a wheelbarrow, a pickaxe, a shovel and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Fiailoa

texts.en: Fiailoa is a 35-year-old married woman with 3 children.  She runs a business selling canned food, freezer, soap, snacks, and others items in her community.  She has 3 years of experience with this business.  Fiailoa has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, sacks of sugar, rice, onions, snacks, soft drinks, cigarettes, crates of vailima beer, noodles, toilet rolls, and salt for her business.  She plans to use her profits to extend her business.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store.

loans.name: Apiseka

texts.en:
Apiseka is 29 years old and married with three children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu (giant taro), and bananas that she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years.

Apiseka needs a loan to buy chemicals, bushknives, wheelbarrow, pick, shovel, and fertilizer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. Apiseka will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bushknives, wheelbarrow, pick, shovel, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bargigul

texts.ru:
Баргигул жительница района Хамадони, занимающаяся животноводством. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и является матерью троих сыновей и двух дочерей. Двое ее сыновья женаты. В данное время ее муж вместе с сыновьями находится на заработках в России. Двое ее дочерей учатся в школе, а невестки не работают. Они ведут домашнее хозяйство, а также помогают свевкрови в ее бизнесе. 
Баргигул вот уже 25 лет как успешно занимается животноводством. Она выращивает крупнорогатый скот для продажи. Баргигул нравится ее деятельность, ведь она продолжает ремесло своих предков. Сейчас для развития бизнеса ей необходимо получить кредит. На сумму кредита она хочет приобрести несколько голов крупно-рогатого скота и увеличить его поголовье.
texts.en: Bargigul is a resident of the Hamadoni district and involved in animal husbandry.  She is 50 years, married and a mother of three sons and two daughters.  Two of her sons are married.  At the present time, her husband and sons work in Russia.  Two of her daughters attend a school, and daughters-in-law do not work.  They run the household and also help their mother-in-law with the business.  Bargigul has been successfully involved in animal husbandry for 25 years.  She raises cattle for sale.  Bargigul likes her business because she is continuing the trade of her ancestors.  Currently she needs a loan for developing the business.  She wants to use the loan amount to purchase several heads of cattle and increase cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase cattle headcount

loans.name: Jursun

texts.ru: Журсун 36 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывают трех детей (3 девочки). Образование среднее. Семья у Журсун очень дружная и трудолюбивая. С 2009 года занимается бизнесом по откорму и перпродаже скота, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS), благодаря ее терпению и трудолюбию на сегодняшний день она получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях развития своего бизнеса по откорму и перепродаже скота, Журсун обратилась в  микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 50 000 сом(KGS) на покупку коров для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. На доходы от кредита Журсун хочет купить скот.
texts.en: Jursun is 36 years old, married and raising three children (three girls) together with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  Jursun's family is very friendly and hardworking.  She has been involved in the business of fattening up and reselling livestock since 2009, having started this business with 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her patience and hard work, today she earns a monthly profit in the amount of 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to develop her business of fattening up and reselling livestock, Jursun requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows for further fattening up and reselling.  Jursun wants to use the earnings from the loan to buy livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows for further fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Intan Ii Group

texts.en:
Cycle 1 of the group Intan II is over, and the members want to continue for the next cycle. There was no change in group membership in Intan II. They were very helpful to all by the presence of Kiva's loan program, especially because the economy of each member of the family is increasing. 

The Intan group II members still have diverse businesses, such as selling bedspreads, wallets and handbags on credit; selling snacks; selling fried dann and soy milk; starting eateries; selling phone pulses, LP gas, pastries, and vegetables. The planned loan is for the second cycle; they will use it to purchase the means of production and increase the types of businesses. All members of the Intan II group thank you for the loan which was given in cycle 1.

Intan II group is led by a woman named Turyati, who is a single parent of two children. She has one son who is still in school. Turyati has a business selling sheets on credit. With this loan, Turyati plans to add other types of businesses, such as selling clothes and bags on credit, because now there is a lot of competition in the selling of sheets. 

She's is hoping that in the next five years, she can have her own stall. These loans are also expected to increase the business and the income of each member of the group, Intan II.

loans.use: to add other products, such as clothes and bags.

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.ru: Барнохон 44 года, вдова. Одна воспитывает 4 детей (2 сына и 2 дочери). После смерти супруга, Барнохон очень долго не могла пережить утрату близкого человека. Нужно было воспитывать и ставить на ноги четверых детей и Барнохон решила взять хозяйство и материальную ответственность в свои руки. В этом ей помогают дети, старший сын находится на заработках в России, младший работает сварщиком. Оба сына как могут поддерживают семью материально, высылая ежемесячно свою заработную плату. Барнохон имеет среднее образование. Соседи отзываются о ней как о предприимчивой и хозяйственной женщине. Барнохон в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается торговлей: постельного белья, одеял, скатертей, начав этот бизнес с 60,000 сом (KGS). Также дополнительным доходом является полеводство, имеет земельный надел размером 1,14 ГА, на которой ежегодно сажает: лук, картофель, капусту. Ее бизнес приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Барнохон вырастить и обустроить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Барнохон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых товаров: таких как, постельное белье, скатерти, одеяла для дальнейшей розничной перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Барнохон планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение товарооборота, а также, намерена в будущем перестроить свой дом.
texts.en: Barnokhon is 44 years old and a widow.  Alone, she is raising four children (two sons and two daughters).  After her husband's death, Barnokhon could not get over the loss of such a close person for a long time.  She needed to raise and get four children on their feet, and Barnokhon decided to take the household and financial responsibility into her own hands.  Her children help her with this.  The oldest son works in Russia, and the youngest works as a welder.  Both sons support the family financially as they can, sending their salaries home monthly.  Barnokhon has a secondary education.  The neighbors speak of her as an entrepreneurial and organized woman.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, Barnokhon has been involved in sales of bedding, blankets and table cloths since 2010, having started this business with 60,000 som (KGS).  Farming also yields an income.  She has a 1.14 hectare land plot, where she annually plants onions, potatoes and cabbage.  Her business yields about 10,000 som (KGS) per month.  The income from the business allowed Barnokhon to raise and situate her children.  In order to further develop her business, Barnokhon requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy merchandise, such as bedding, table cloths and blankets, wholesale for future retail sale.  She plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase her goods turnover and also to rebuild her house in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as bedding, table cloths and blankets, wholesale for future retail sale

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.ru: Нуринисо 36 летняя швея. Она не замужем и проживает с родителями, братьями и невестками в районе Хамадони. Ее отец работает в лесном хозяйстве района, а братья уехали на заработки. Нуринисо имеет собственный швейный бизнес. Она в 2008 году на рынке района открыла маленький швейный цех и уже 5 лет занимается там предоставлением услуги по пошиву женских национальных платьев. В ее цехе работают несколько работниц. Ее бизнес хорошо продвигается и приносит ей хороший стабильный доход. Нуринисо для расширения своего бизнеса просит кредит. Она хочет купить новую швейную машинку. С полученной прибыли она планирует купить один холодильник.
texts.en: Nuriniso is a 36 year-old seamstress.  She is not married and lives with the parents, brothers and sisters-in-law in the Hamadoni district.  Her father works at the district forestry, and brother left for work.  Nuriniso has her own sewing business.  She opened a small sewing factory at a district market in 2008 and has been involved in sewing national women's dresses for 5 years.  Several employees work at this factory.  Her business is going well and yields her a stable income.  Nuriniso is requesting this loan to expand her business.  She wants to buy a new sewing machine.  She plans to use the resulting profit to buy one refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Panji

texts.ru: Панжи житель района Кубадиён. Ему 49 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих сыновей и двух дочерей. Панжи земледелец. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. У него имеется 0,12 га приусадебного участка земли. Дети Панжи уже повзрослели. Их необходимо обустроить в жизни, дать им образование, женить. Поэтому Панжи хочет заняться новым бизнесом и выбрал для этого животноводство. Он будет совмещать земледелие с животноводством. Панжи накопил сбережение в размере 3000 таджикских сомони, а также во дворе дома имеет коровник. Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить 5 голов коров и телят, а также корм. Панжи будет откармливать скот в течение одного месяца и затем продавать на местном рынке по прибыльной цене. Он уже составил свой бизнес-план и теперь ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: Panji is a resident of the Qubadiyon district.  He is 49 years old, married and has two sons and two daughters.  Panji is a farmer.  He is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He has 0.12 hectares of land by his house.  Panji's children are already grown.  They need to be situated in life, provided with education and married off.  This is why Panji wants to get involved in a new business and chose animal husbandry.  He will combine farming with animal husbandry.  Panji saved 3000 Tajik somoni and also has a cowshed in his house yard.  He requested a loan to buy five heads of cows and calves and also livestock feed.  Panji will fatten up livestock for one month and then sell it a local market at a profitable price.  He already created his business plan and now awaits support.

loans.use: to buy five heads of cows and calves and also livestock feed in order to start a new business

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel posee  48 años, es casado, procreo 4 hijos todos mayores de edad y solo viven con un hijo, la esposa de su hijo  y dos nietas.

El es albañil, trabajo que realiza desde que era joven. Antes vivia en otra zona, pero por el conflicto civil en el país, se traslado a su domicilio actual. Ahí conoció a la que ahora es su esposa. Cuando vivia con sus padres en el lugar inicial, fue donde empezó como ayudante de albañil, luego con su esfuerzo y dedicación perfeccionó el oficio y ahora trabaja por su propia cuenta. También, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz para el consumo familiar.

 El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción de una cocina de ladrillo, pues la que actualmente tiene esta  elaborada en el corredor,  sus bases son de horcones y lamina, que esta bastante deteriorada por la lluvia y se moja la honrilla de leña y un granero donde almacena el maíz que cosecha.


Él espera tener una mejor construcción en su casa y evitar que esa construcción vieja le pueda causar un accidente a alguien de su familia, porque cuando hace mucho viento fuerte o lluvias tempestuosas parece que se cae. Por otra parte, evita que los animales domésticos entren a ese lugar; ya que se tiene problemas porque los perros y gallinas se suben a la hornilla y se comen o deterioran los alimentos .
texts.en:
Michael is 48 years old, married and has 4 adult children. He lives with one son, his daughter-in-law and two granddaughters.

He has been a mason since he was young. Before, he lived in another area but because of the civil conflict in the country, he moved to his current location. There he met the woman who is now his wife. When he lived with his parents in the first location he became an assistant mason. Through his effort and dedication he perfected his craft and now works on his own. He also works in agriculture and plants corn for his family to eat.
 
The loan will be used to purchase materials to build a brick oven, which is currently constructed in the corridor. The oven is currently damaged by rain, as are the wood-burning stove and the barn where he stores the corn harvest.

He also hopes to improve the construction of his home to avoid an accident involving someone in his family, because when there is strong wind or rain it looks like it might fall down. He would also like to prevent his pets from entering this area, because he has problems with the dogs and chickens getting on the oven and eating or spoiling the food.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a brick oven.

loans.name: Orostamo

texts.ru: Оростамо 41 год. Она замужняя женщина, имеющая троих сыновей, которым по 16,15 и 13 лет. Все они учатся в школе. У Оростамо семейный торговый бизнес. Она совместно с мужем занимается продажей канцелярских товаров. В частности она продает тетради, ручки, бумаги размера А4, папки, альбомы, циркуль и т.д. Ее магазин расположен на центральном рынке города. Оростамо начала этот бизнес в 2007 году и до сих пор продолжает его. Так как сейчас сезон покупок школьных принадлежностей, Оростамо необходимо увеличить ассортимент своих товаров. С этой целью она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она собирается приобрести широкий ассортимент канцелярских товаров и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Orostamo is 41 years old.  She is a married woman, who has three sons, ages 16, 15 and 13.  All of them attend a school.  Orostamo has a family retail business.  She and her husband are involved in selling office goods.  Specifically, she sells notebooks, pens, A4 size paper, binders, albums, compasses, etc.  Her store is located at the city central market.  Orostamo started this business in 2007 and continues it still.  Orostamo needs to expand her merchandise selection because this is the season for buying school supplies.  She requested a loan for this purpose.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy a wide selection of office supplies and thus increase her good turnover.

loans.use: to buy a wide selection of office supplies and thus increase her good turnover

loans.name: Amirkhon

texts.ru: Амирхон житель северной части Таджикистана города Худжанд. Ему 26 лет. Он женат и имеет одну трехлетнюю дочь. Амирхон энергичный и отзывчивый человек. Он зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. Его жена домохозяйка, а дочь ходит в детский сад. Амирхон в течение 6 лет работает таксистом по маршрутной линии своего города. Его рабочий день начинается с 5:00 часов утра и продолжается до 17:00 часов вечера. Амирхон работает усердно, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Прибыль с деятельности является единственным источником его дохода. Амирхон сейчас нуждается в кредите. Он просит кредит для приобретения автомобильных шин, чтобы заменить старые шины на новых и продолжить деятельность.
texts.en: Amirkhon is a resident of the northern part of Tajikistan, the city of Khujand.  He is 26 years old, married and has one three-year-old daughter.  Amirkhon is an energetic and responsive person.  He earns a living by providing a taxi service.  His wife is a homemaker, and daughter goes to a kindergarten.  Amirkhon has been working as a taxi driver along the shuttle route of his city for 6 years.  His work day starts at 5:00 in the morning and continues until 17:00 in the evening.  Amirkhon works diligently to provide for his family.  The profit from the business is the sole source of income for him.  Amirkhon currently needs a loan.  He is requesting this loan to buy car tires in order to replace old tires with new ones and continue his business.

loans.use: to buy car tires in order to replace old tires with new ones and continue his business

loans.name: Akmal

texts.ru: Акмал трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он не женат и является студентом 3 курса. Он учится в Российской Федерации в городе Самаре. Акмал учится отлично и хорошо. Он начитанный молодой человек и всегда в поиске новшества. Во время каникулы Акмал приезжает домой в Таджикистан. Он помогает маме по садоводству. Акмал должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3900 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. В будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом.
texts.en: Akmal is a hardworking and conscientious person.  He is not married and a third-year student.  He studies in the Russian Federation in the city of Samara.  Akmal studied excellently in school.  He is a well-read young person and always seeks something new.  Akmal comes home to Tajikistan during his school breaks.  He helps his mother with gardening.  Akmal has to pay for his tuition contract, but does not have money.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3900 US dollars to pay for his tuition.  He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.  He dreams of becoming a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 32 años es una responsable madre soltera. Vive junto a su hija en una pequeña vivienda que fue heredada por su madre hace 8 años. Agradece a Dios por la madre que tubo, pues ella le brindó las herramientas para poder salir adelante, le heredó su casa y 5 hectáreas de terreno productivo, donde se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papa y alverja. Sus terrenos se sitúan en una zona muy lejana, ella tiene que caminar muchas horas para llegar a cuidar de sus sembríos, que en tiempos de cosechas contrata peones, para que trabajen la tierra junto con ella. Cuenta que es muy rentable su actividad, pues ella misma traslada sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende sus alimentos. “Hay fechas en las que tengo que comprar otras cosechas para poder abastecer a mis clientes”, afirma. Por ello su objetivo, es poder convertirse en distribuidora y poder tener mayores ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Martha, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de más cosechas de alverjas y todo tipo de verduras para su negocio.
texts.en: Martha is a 32-year-old responsible single mother. She lives with her daughter in a small home that she inherited from her mother eight years ago. She thanks God for her mother, who provided Martha will the tools to be able to make headway. She inherited her mother's home and five hectares of fertile land where she grows corn, potatoes and peas. Her land is located very far away, so Martha has to walk many hours in order to care for her crops, and during the harvest she hires laborers to work the fields with her. She says that the activity is very profitable since she transports the goods herself to the wholesale market in the city of Huancayo, where she sells her products. "There are dates where I have to buy other crops in order to provide for my customers," she said. Therefore, her goal is to become a distributor and earn even better profits. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support she receives to make headway. Furthermore, she promises to make her payments on time and in the established period. Martha plans to use the loan to purchase more peas and all kinds of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase peas and all kinds of vegetables.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is a 42-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small business, providing a tailoring service to the community. She has many years with this business. Tina needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, materials, needles, threads and oil. She will use her profits to support her children's education. Tina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, materials, threads, needles and oil.

loans.name: Tala

texts.en:
Tala is 30 years old and married with two children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and taamu that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. Tala needs a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals and filings for the plantation.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services. Tala will use the profits from her sales to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, chemicals and filings.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
Lusia is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lusia has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, a file, gloves, boots, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.
 
She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. With her profits, Lusia hopes to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, a file, gloves, boots, fertilizer and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 32 года. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Гулнора более 15 лет занимается бизнесом. Она начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Данное время она занимается купле продажей промышленных товаров, как мыло, шампунь, стиральный порошок и т.д. Она имеет свою торговую точку. Гулнора работает упорно с раннего утра, так как семья у них большая 10 человек, и она должна зарабатывать много денег, чтобы содержать семью. Гулнора планирует увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 долларов США для покупки промышленных товаров как мыло, порошок и т.п. В будущем она планирует открыть собственный магазин. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnora is a hardworking woman.  She is 32 years old.  She is divorced and does not have children.  Gulnora has been a businesswoman for over 15 years.  She started her business by sewing women's clothes.  Today she buys and sells manufactured goods such as soap, shampoo, detergent, etc.  She has her own sales location.  Gulnora works hard from early morning, as her family is large and has 10 people and she needs to earn a lot of money to support the family.  Gulnora plans to increase her working capital.  She is asking for a loan of 2,500 US dollars for the purchase of products such as soap, detergent, etc.  In the future, she plans to open her own store.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy manufactured goods such as soap and detergent and to increase working capital

loans.name: Dúo Solidario La Finquita Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO LA FINQUITA
LA SEÑORA VICTORIA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD QUIEN ES PROPIETARIA DE VACAS Y TERNERITAS QUE TIENE EN SU CASA, ES MADRE DE FAMILIA DE 4 HIJOS ES UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA QUE DIA A DIA LUCHA POR SALIR ADELANTE Y BUSCAR MEJORAS EN SU FAMILIA ELLA DESDE MUY TEMPRANO SE LEVANTA PARA ORDEÑAR Y LUEGO SALIR A VENDER LA LECHE DENTRO DE LA COMUNIDAD TIENE MUCHOS SUEÑOS Y METAS QUE DESEA QUE ALGUN DIA SE CUMPLAN Y SE LLEVEN A CABO DENTRO DE SUS ACTIVIDADES CUANDO SE DESOCUPA SALEN A PASTOREAR LAS VACAS LUEGO A ALIMENTARLAS PARA TENERLAS LISTAS PARA EL SIGUIENTE DIA ELLA DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SE CONVIERTAN EN PERSONAS DE BIEN PARA QUE PUEDAN TENER UN MEJOR ESTILO DE VIDA AL QUE ELLA HA TENIDO ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE VACAS LECHERAS PARA TENER UNA MAYOR CANTIDAD DE LECHE PARA LA VENTA Y ASI TENER MEJORES GANANCIAS PARA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en: Victoria is 35 years old and owns cows and calves that she keeps at home. This mother of four children is an enterprising woman who fights day to day to make headway and find the best for her family. She gets up very early to milk her cows and then she goes out to sell the milk within the community. She has a lot of dreams and goals that she hopes one day to fulfill and tries to work toward them when she has time while the cows are grazing. Victoria wants her children to become good people who can have a better lifestyle than she has had. She is requesting the loan to purchase cows to increase the amount of milk she sells, and in this way she will have more profits to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to raise.

loans.name: Diariatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 16 Juillet 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très engagées et désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une entente et un esprit d’être aide  entre les membres du groupe, Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce.

Madame Diariatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont deux filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus et autres articles vestimentaires. Elle se procure la marchandise au marché dans les régions du central ou à la capitale, pour la revente à crédit en deux mensualités.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter des habits pour enfants par douzaines pour la revente au détail par unité.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire participer de manière significative à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Created July 16, 2012, the banc villageois is made up of women who are very committed and eager to make their revenue-generating businesses prosper.
